reviewText: There are dozens of phenomenal bakeries in the Denver area, but Gateaux stands out above the rest for their creativity, organization, cost, flexibility, and of course, delectability! The head Chef, Michelle, is incredibly easy to work with and made this aspect of the planning process totally seamless. I will be going back for any event, big or small.

We ordered a carrot cake for a birthday, and really had a Gateaux creation that was the hit of the party.  The icing was unique and not real sweet, but was really good.  The sponge had a great flavor with a generous amount of shredded carrots and nuts.  There were pieces of white chocolate decorated on the cake which topped off the taste. It was delish!

Out for a walk and came across this little bakery. Our mouths were so happy!!

Super friendly gal met us at the front counter.  The cakes in the display case were amazing to look at, the frosted shortbread cookies were delightful, and the other items equally tempting.

We had shortbread cookies - lovely texture, right balance of crumble and sweet; dark chocolate tart - we split this and it was the perfect amount; the mousse was rich, yet not heavy; caramel apple cake - not overly sweet, with visible pieces of apple in a nice spice cake.

If I lived in Denver, I would be a frequent customer!

Wedding or birthday or retirement cakes. If you are looking for a special cake, you need to look here. Cakes are handmade and they will do anything for your needs. They also sell cupcakes for your sweet tooth. The wait people are also very helpful to help you plan your special cake.

Every time I have been here, the customer service never fails. In the service world, customer service is king, because so many are offering products that are nearly equal. That said, each and every tasty treat I've picked up has been far from equal. Gateaux rises above, and I look forward to the next occasion so I can order another decadent goody.
Please keep doing what you do.

Gateaux's is quite a beautiful bakery and manages to do amazing delicious work.  They make creations to your order and do a great job.  Cookies, cakes and a myriad of baked items are available for order or purchase. Need a specialty cake with a special design?  This is the place to visit.  Nice folks and great tastes.
Loved the pastries, especially the blueberry scone, which had so much blueberry filling. Great stuff all around here.

For birthdays this is always the first place to go on my list. We always stop here to pick up a specialty cake for the kids which they always do perfectly. The cookies always make us get something more than just the cake.

Elegant, affordable, hit or miss with the individual assortments. Some were delicious some weren't our taste as to be expected. Highly recommend the little blue cake that looks like a present. Very friendly staff.

Gateaux is a quaint bakery that has amazing pastries, cakes and cookies. Their butter cookies are amazing, and you wont find another one like it anywhere. It's a great place to sit and have a cup of coffee with a pastry, or to take one of the beautiful pastries/cakes home. If you are looking for a special cake to be made, this is also the place to order it. We have been coming to Gateaux for over 8 years and have had beautiful cakes made for birthdays, graduations, and other special occasions. 

We live about 15 miles away, and gladly will deal with the Denver traffic to get one of their goodies! 

Treat yourself!
reviewTitle: OOOOH La La! Best Butter Cookies anywhere!

reviewText: If you like full body coffee DazBog is thsi place to go. Some shops are franchised and others owned by corporate. Service is pretty consistent and you will get a good strong cup of coffee.

After having our 1st custom cake delivered & tasted I just fell in love with Gateaux !!!! Simply excellent ... Michelle karmona is a sweetheart . She always made the perfect cake for us for our special occasions !!!! I just can"t think of any other bakery or pastry chef other than Gateaux n Michelle whenever we need a special cake .
reviewTitle: This the one I always go for !!!!

reviewText: Love the cakes- fresh with amazing presentation and flare!  The carrot cake is awesome!  Love their tea cookies - they are one of a kind!

I ordered a special cake for my son's birthday and asked that the outside be frosted with a buttercream.  While the cake itself was sufficiently moist, the buttercream contained no hint of real butter.  As an avid baker, I know what real buttercream tastes like; what a disappointment!

If I lived in Denver this would be my go to bakery for all occasions!! Not only is everything delicious, but it is also artistically done with great detail.  The customer service is absolutely the best I've ever received in a bakery.  Willing to help, accommodate, and make your day!! My sister and I were visiting from out of town and at the last minute were in need of 120 cookies to give as gifts and on the spot can you believe they had that many gingerbread men?! All beautifully wrapped and ready to go!  If only I lived in Denver...
They have a seasonal pumpkin cheesecake which is the holiday season wrapped into a delicious treat. I order it every holiday season to share with friends.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.

I recently ordered  a custom birthday cake for my wife's b-day. I placed the custom cake order via email and followed up with a phone call  since I was not from the area. Everything  went off without a hitch and the Dark chocolate ganache icing, chocolate cake, and layers of mocha cream was exquisite. My wife and guests  definitely raved over the quality and flavor of the cake. Thanks for the memorable experience and will definitely call again when in Denver.

We had a special to order cake for a 40th birthday party. It was phenomenal! The decorations (made to our specifications) were awesome! It was better than we had anticipated. It was delivered on time and tasted great too. I would highly recommend.

I just stopped in one time but I was blown away by their selection and the beauty of their pastries.  I would have liked to have one of everything but my waist just can't do that.  I settled on a small assortment of breakfesty things and a walked away with an adorable tea cookie.  YUMMY!!!   It was hard for me to walk away with sampling their Petite Fours.  What really got me excited was that the ship!  Guess what my co-workers and family are getting for Christmas...Snowman Pops!
reviewTitle: I think I fell in love!

reviewText: Ordered a baby shower cake and paid over $80 for it.  Got it home followed their directions of bringing it to room temperature, etc.  The buttercream cracked, revealing the chocolate cake, not to mention the chocolate "pregnant mom" broke before anyone even got to see the cake.  The cake was dry and the frosting tasteless.  I understand that the taste of cake is very subjective, but the cake cracking is unacceptable, I won't use them again. Overrated!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I had to go to Buenos Aires to find the wonder of Argentinian pastries and desserts, and was overjoyed to discover Argentinian  Baker in Irving on my return.  If you haven't tried for whatever reason, try it - it's the best - bar none!!!!!!!
reviewTitle: Went to Buenos Aires to find this bakery

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Amazing! We had empanadas for lunch and they were fantastic!  Beef and cheese, chicken and meat and egg!!they were all moist, slightly spicy with wonderful flavors in a flaky pastry! We then had a cream and strawberry tarte and a slice of ricotta tarte. Both were amazing! Creamy and not too sweet but just enough! Cute cafe setting and great service!!they also have a coffee bar and I had a vanilla latte which was great!
reviewTitle: A sweet gem of a cafe!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Heard from our Argentinian friend this place was good-and it is! Had some yummy warm crusty empanadas with different meat fillings. Came with some excellent homemade sauce. Everything in the bakery case looked scrumptious but I resisted. Maybe next time.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Las Facturas de mala calidad, no se  sentian frescas. el servicio el bueno pero deben mejorar sus productos
reviewTitle: Calidad de producto no muy buenos

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
The service is consistently friendly and the everything is always fresh and takes me back to Argentina!!  I had to stock up! 
Please open in Austin the  Argentines here  need you!!!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: There was a cashier (orange haired girl) who I was watching while I was in like and she was honestly incredibly rude and arrogant towards every single customer in front of me.She was directing herself very demanding towards everybody when the customers were literally just trying to get some food.Neither of the cashiers had name tags but even when I called after to complain about this she did not want to tell me her name.During my visit to the bakery ,she was acting rude to the people ordering and hesitating to change an order she had made wrong.After she noticed me looking at her she tried to give me good service but that did not fix anything.While I was cashing out the other cashier asked the orange haired girl a price for something and she directed to her in a mean and rude way which I could notice and hear.Customers come in here expecting a good customer service and be able to walk out satisfied but she ruins people’s days and just acts like she shouldn’t towards customers without any good reason.Please don’t let her handle customers anymore because I know I’m not the only one who has seen this happen.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: The staff is helpful, kind and efficient.  The food is delicous, great quality and reasonably priced.  Its a little slice of heaven on earth.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Stopped in for a pastry and coffee. Lots to choose from, freshly made. Custom orders can be made also. Cakes, cookies, snacks, etc. Some warm items during breakfast as well. Tasty chai tea and coffee.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: We love meeting here for coffee and desserts.  Everything is always so good!  Customer service is always nice and fast.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I visit quite often so they get my fair share of money. Not today. Both ladies behind the counter appeared "too busy" to service me and both kept me waiting for about 5 minutes. No greeting, no apologies, nothing. RUDE! Meanwhile, the customer before me got his item quickly and a "Have a Nice Day!" I barely got asked if I wanted my receipt. What's up ladies?!? One bad experience = never going back. Pretty ladies, ugly attitudes!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
Pastries, pastries and more pastries. 

This is a great little establishment. All kinds of pastries both savoury and sweet. Additionally they sell products from Argentina. 
The empanadas are excellent. 
I must say the macarons are the best I have ever tasted. 

Come in for the empanadas, stay fir the alfajors.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
Stunning cakes and sumptuous pastries.  Savory empanadas hot and tasty! 
Freshly brewed coffee to top it all off!
I am lucky I don’t live near here or I would weigh 500 lbs!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I had the absolute worst experience with this bakery! I sent them a picture of the cake I wanted for my daughter's first birthday and I was quoted a price. To my utmost surprise, I got a text the morning of pickup that I had to pay an extra $20 if I wanted the number 1 on the cake as was in the picture. I went to the bakery, and after complaining for about 30 minutes, I was told it'll take 25 minutes to have the number put on. Sadly, it gets worse! Not only did they spell my daughter's name wrong on the cake, they also made it whipped cream icing instead of the fondant icing like I had ordered! All the while, I never even got a simple apology! I was told to send an email. I went home only to find that instead of a 2nd tier vanilla cake, I got chocolate!! I can't say enough terrible things about this place, just stay away if you don't want your big day ruined!!!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: The atmosphere and variety are outstanding and, the quality of the foods and pastry's  are exceptional!  Frankly, I won't go anywhere else now!  The people are personable and, friendly.  I have had the opportunity to meet the owner and, when you do you'll know why this Bakery stands out!
reviewTitle: Finding Argentina Bakery was a Bonus!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Been coming to this bakery since the week they opened the doors. During Christmas, they make an Argentine version of the German "schwieneohren" (literally pigs ears) that are a spot-on duplicate of the pastries I got when I was stationed in Germany. Everything is fabulous. The alfajores de maizena are my favorites. They are made with a combination of corn starch and wheat flour; so tender they melt in your mouth. I always get them after I finish with my empanadas con huevo y jalapeno. They have a selection of espresso drinks, like latte and cappuccino, as well as gourmet teas and regular coffee. I always buy our family birthday cakes here. They have chocolate tres leches cakes with strawberry filling between layers, and glazed fruits on top. My family can't get enough of them.
reviewTitle: Better coffee, better desserts, fresh empanadas

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Caramel cake was moist and flavorful.  White cake with strawberry whipped cream icing  was beautifully decorated with fruit.  I was a bit disappointed that grapes were still on the stems.  Both cakes were light and delicious.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
This place is amazing. GREAT coffee, great empanadas, and scrumptious pastries. I wanted to order everything in the case, and I am definitely coming back to order a chocoflan cake!

Beautiful, and very well appointed sitting area. Leather and heavy wood furniture. I felt like I was in Argentina.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: wide selection of desserts and all are really good. Their cakes and pastries are fluffy and moist and  have the light cream icing, so it doesn't feel too heavy or too sweet. Their Tres leches cake is my personal favorite! Too many great options to pick from.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: A wonderful bakery or panaderia right in Irving. What a great way to have a traditional Argentinian treat. Es muy bueno!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Their Tres Leche Cakes are perfect everytime! We order them for Birthday celebrations at work.  They might be a little bit more money then other Bakeries, but highly understandable.  Quality all the way!

Dined for lunch and had the bacon cheeseburger with curly fries and bleu cheese dressing- and as always, just what one would hope for in a proper, satisfying burger. Stef, my party's server, made especially careful to make our experience ideal. I love the Dark Horse but I must say that Stef's consistently friendly demeanor and timely attention to my party's needs, make these lunch visits one of the best parts of my day. I will definitely be returning soon. Ask for Stef!
reviewTitle: best server at the shady pony

reviewText: We stopped here for lunch along our drive from Denver to Estes Park. I had a great Caesar salad and my husband had a burger. It was a busy place but the service was very good. The bathroom signs make it worth your while to stop here all by themselves!

The Dark Horse was ideal for a casual Sunday dinner. As always the burgers were great and the beer was reasonably priced. Service was excellent including the bartenders who found a nice souvenir t-shirt for us. We had tried to go on the previous night but it was packed out with CU students having a Saturday night at the Dark Horse watching the football game on the many TV screens. We are glad we tried again Sunday!
reviewTitle: The Dark Horse is a great place for a casual meal and drink!

reviewText: We arrived for a late lunch, and we were seated immediately. We all got burgers, all good, but not exceptional. The atmosphere is what really makes this place great! Loads of cool artifacts. Unlike other reviews, a waitress came and took our order. The food took a little bit to arrive, but nothing outrageous. Overall, a good experience!

This bar is legend and it is tragic that it is going away - The food is and always has been a 4/5, BUT the atmosphere / decor and the upstairs areas, are truly unique and genuinely historical - Sniveling Stan R, and his party of 8 are less than vague about what was rude w/ mgmt and gives zero specifics about why his experience was bad - If it was busy (as it often is) it's not hard at all to imagine a party of 8, who don't know this venue, coming away feeling like service was less than at a higher end bar.  It's a dive, and always has been.  The building, interior and staff haveh a ton of lovable quirks and a still larger amount of history.  Betting Stan had a bad experience at least partly of his party of 8's making.
reviewTitle: Awesome place!  Ignore the ignorant nay-sayer(s)... small sample of negative people

reviewText: I cannot wait for this bar to close. The manager was very rude to my group of 8 people. Too many bars in Boulder for us to go out of our way to go here.

Amazed at the friendliness of the staff, all of them.  That kind of service and engaging people is rare these days.  Yes, the food was tasty, but it's the staff that takes this over the top.  You order at a station, then pick up your food, drinks at the bar, and they are so helpful and seem happy to be there.

It was late and rainy and we were just getting to town. Google maps brought this up. We should have checked this app!  Anyhow, parking and entrance felt sketchy ... And first stop (restrooms) were the greatest with some drunk young women touching up their lip gloss.  The decor was eclectic and a little grungy.  First tip - always note emergency exits since this place could be challenging to evacuate in a hurry.  Next, hurry to the kitchen window to place your food order them to the bar to get drinks while waiting.  Plenty of people watching for entertainment.  My name was called to the kitchen windowand the fellows in the kitchen were beyond helpful with tips to sit and grabbing flatware and napkins.  Our food? One of the best flat iron steaks we've ever had! Slaw was great as was garlic bread.  And the chef salad was the largest we've ever seen and was super fresh and tasty.  We ended up going back to the kitchen window for to-go containers and had enough salad for another meal.  Definitely worth the stop.  One last reflection, lots of people in the line at the kitchen were getting orders to go and waiting a good while for the food since the kitchen was slammed.  This biz is over 50 yrs old for a reason!
reviewTitle: Don't judge a book - good food inside!

reviewText: It was a great spot for a casual team dinner. Nice character, a bit loud, with lots of surprises everywhere ;) The chicken burger was amazing.

The 3 joint wings are deceptively small. You would think you are getting huge wings when you hear they serve them with the flat and drumsticks still intact. In reality there is little meat on the wings. Dry rub seasoning was good though, just a rip off for $15. The red pepper poppers were excellent. I don't like the taste of jalapenos so the red jalapeno was a nice twist. A less hot, more smoky tasting jalapeno. Raspberry sauce was a bit odd as a dipper so I just ate them as is. Tons of cream cheese and well breaded.

What an eclectic place! So neat. Love the logg cabin type structure. Lots of nooks and separate areas to enjoy drinks and food together. Funky decor and quirky styling. Great place to play eye spy haha. 
We are here for lunch while passing through Boulder. You order at the counter and pick up at window, no table service. Food was good. Perfectly fine sandwich for ten bucks. No complaints. Soft Drinks are refillable at bar.

Classic college bar with endless curly fries, burgers, wings type faire, ceiling covered w old buggies and various antiques. Many ups and downs, booth tables , pool, video games etc.beware ..wings are hot

A very unpleasant experience unfortunately... we ordered food and beers as usually, and I had just ordered and paid for my second beer when staff went around the bar to check IDs... upon showing my International driving licence, the staff member, a very young and exceptionally rude person, snapped at me that international IDs were not accepted, took my almost full beer from me and told me to leave. 
While I appreciate making sure kids don't drink, this behaviour towards an international person in their 30s is both unnecessary, discriminating and leaves me wondering why the bartender was allowed to accept money for my beer... thanks for the racism!
This place definitely had a college student drinking spot vibe, but they gave great portions and the food was good. Servers were very friendly as well.

I LOVE the Dark Horse, love the food, love the atmosphere, love that its 1/2 mile from my house.  We go there several times a month.  I appreciate that during Covid they have done what they needed to stay in business with safety in mind.  They had my support and they had my business. HAD. Yesterday I went in to pick up some food and EVERYONE was without masks and there were a TON of people in there, mostly people in their 20's and 30's.  I can guarantee not everyone has been vaccinated and thats what the latest CDC report has advised.  If you are fully vaccinated and have that two week immunity, you don't have to wear your masks unless a business requires it.  I know everyone is ready to rip those masks off, I'm there too.  I've been fully vaccinated since March 2021.  I have immunity.  My household has been vaccinated and has immunity.  I will not be going back to the Dark Horse for now.  I will be telling people about my experience.  Safety is more important than anything else.
reviewTitle: May 17th Open and EVERYONE was without masks ... even the unvaccinated.  Not safe.

reviewText:
A hidden gem.  From the outside, this place looks a bit sketch.  When you enter...Wow.  The ambiance and decor is absolutely stunning.  Only photos can capture this.
The food?  Very good.  We recommend the chicken tenders (make sure you ask for them in basted in sauce).  The onion rings are very crispy, but a bit lean on the onion.
The gourmet hamburgers are very large and stacked tall with toppings.
The staff are very friendly.  Definitely recommend popping in!
reviewTitle: A hidden gem; wait until you walk in!

reviewText: Burger and fries - this is the second time this week that I’ve ordered the blues burger and fries. Burger was incredible but fries both times were so salty that I was unable to eat them.  I LOVE salt and always end up adding salt to my fries at other restaurants…Not at the Dark Horse! The first time I ordered the fries I thought it was a fluke… Second time, I’ve learned my lesson and will never order their fries again!!

Met a friend for lunch.  Nice day, was able to be seated outside.

Pretty good burger, not great.  Great service, server checked up on us as necessary.  Good music, not so loud you can't have a conversation.  Right across the street from some large CU dorms, so I imagine they are pretty hopping on the weekend.

The bathroom door trick is stupid.  Just stop it.

Love the dark, antique style of this place! It's like a blast from the past. Pretty cool atmosphere.

I ordered the quesadillas and red chile poppers, both were really good!! The burgers and onion rings were also really good. Super cool for angsty antiquers who love a char broiled burger.

Had great burgers and fries, very fresh burger toppings and side salads. Fries were very good and red pepper poppers were perfect. Felt very comfortable eating here as staff made everything easy and safe.

My husband and I stopped in for breakfast Wednesday, August 28, 2024. 
The waitress was quick to our table.  My husband ordered the CF Steak breakfast.  I ordered a Chef Salad after confirming 'it wasn't too early to order a salad'.
Meals were served.  This is the second time of three visits that my chef salad arrived without the hard-boiled egg touted on the menu.  
The first time this happened, I wasn't told there were no hard-boiled eggs until after the salad was in front of me and I pointed out that there was no egg.  I didn't want to upset our meal, so I dropped it.  And paid full price for that 'chef' salad without an egg.  
Same thing yesterday.  The salad arrived.  No egg.   We called the waitress over.  I began ... "The only reason I order a Chef Salad is ..." ... and the waitress finished my sentence .. "For the egg."   
I replied "Yes, for the egg."  Isn't that the cornerstone of a chef salad?
I asked, "Will we be charged full price for the salad?"  The waitress replied, "Yes".
I gave her the salad back.  The waitress asked if I'd like to order something else.  I replied, "Not now."  (At this point, it didn't seem wise to ask a cook to make something else after sending food back.)
Point:  The waitress knows there are no eggs but doesn't say anything when I ordered.  The cook knows too.  If my husband ordered an extra egg for his breakfast, he would have been charged the ala carte price.
A Chef Salad is offered on the menu ... with an egg.  Without the egg ... it's not a chef salad. 
Seems like a pattern ... 'maybe you'll get an egg, maybe you won't, but you'll pay for it either way ...'
Disappointing.  Very disappointing.
Chef Salad = egg.   If you don't have them (again) ... say so up front.    
My husband's meal was fine.

Gross 🤮 this place is completely trash unless you got an iron stomach stay away ! The food was so inedible the kids didn’t hardly touch it ! The manager there is a complete joke and needs fired on the spot if they want to keep their restaurant opened ! Like we’re not coming back we would like some compensation for our 100$ ticket that was trash food my dog wouldn’t even touch it if i tried ! When I tell you this is the worst restaurant in America take my warning seriously and save your money go somewhere you won’t get sick from trying to eat their nastiness! I really hope this reaches the owner he needs new staff and to get his food corrected or close the doors if not because that was not edible the health inspector will be called and I promise repercussions will be taken ! Please take this serious everyone and stay away save your money and your health !
reviewTitle: Terrible food in edible and the manager needs fired right away !

reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with our meal. The restaurant was very clean. The salad bar was fully stocked and offered soup choices as well. There was a decent selection on the buffet. My husband ordered from the menu and was satisfied with his meal. Not a bad place overall.
reviewTitle: Not a bad place to stop. Good variety for the family.

reviewText: We haven’t eaten at an Iron Skillet in years. We ate from the buffet. I have to say this is some of the best chicken, potatoes and gravy I have had in a long time. The salad bar was fresh and selection good. Yes, we will eat here again.

We had a bad experience here a few months ago; but was told they have resolved their issues, and have a new cook. So, for some unknown reason, we took another chance. Wish now, we hadn’t stopped. 
       After today, Im thinking this new fellow is the old cook’s brother. The chicken breast was so dried out, it wasn’t edible. Sent it back, and was replaced by a version of chicken fried steak; which was just as badly over cooked. On the flip, the so called Baked potato (microwaved), wasn’t cooked all the way through. Salad bar was lacking many of the normal veggies. Soup looked like it was made about a week ago. BTW, Service was just ok, and not very friendly. 
      I’m not sure what has happened to this chain of restaurants; as Petro used to be one of the better choices on the road. But, like most truck stops, they just don’t care anymore. Did I complain? Of course: Did it matter? Not at all.     
       As you can see from the pic, it’s hard to identify what meat was actually served. To me, it appears as if the bus boy ran over something with his Jeep on the way in to work.  My Advice is to Save your money for an actual meal down the road....

We’ve all eaten at a petro or 2 across the country, with some being ok, and some not so much. This one in Milan is about as bad as I’ve had. I learned a long time ago to stay clear of the buffet all together: Although I do think the location in north Little Rock, AR is decent. So, here I Ordered a sirloin with fried shrimp, which comes with the salad bar. Petro used to have a pretty good salad bar, but this one is lacking too many regular items. 
    Now I realize these steaks are not coming from Ruth Chris, but the cuts they’re buying must be the lowest grade possible. The steak(ordered med-rare) comes out dry, flat, and about 3/8” thick. So, since they clearly cooked that one med-well, they try again. This time the next steak wasn’t even rare: More like raw. I asked them to take it off please; and it was like an act of Congress to get this done. 
     On top of all this, the service was lousy. Drinks were never refilled, and the server was absent most of the time. We did see her talking and cutting up with a “regular” as others were waiting for her as well. Management here isn’t much better. We would’ve have eaten elsewhere, if not for the enormous points we had built up, (from buying so much fuel) for a free meal. But,That one is on ME!!!.... “you get what u pay for”...
All n all, if you’re hungry, you may want to go across the street to the Diner... sorry

All across America Petro and TA are substituting there diners for fast food trash food and here's a great example why. The buffet food is sub-par at best and never worth the price. It's bland, basic and limited in selection. The biggest issue is apparently no-one ever heard of using a spoon to stir the food. Almost every single TA buffet is the same with concrete congealed food on top the pan! It looks like it's sat for most the day, and who wants that? I usually get the buffet to go and even what little is edible ain't worth it. They need to save the diners and buffet's instead of removing them! We just need better food with people who actually care how it's prepared and presented...
reviewTitle: Why Petro/TA is losing the buffet

reviewText: I have eaten here at least 10 times.  Once I had the breakfast, it is very good.  But mostly, I have the buffet.  On their buffet selection their fried chicken is delicious.  They also make this spicy seafood jambalaya-like entre that I love to put on my mashed potatoes.  It is so good. They also make roast pork.  Sometimes I really like their roast pork.  To me, when the pieces (slices) are small they taste better.  So, when their pieces (slices) are large, I have learned to avoid it.

I know. It is your typical Iron Skillet buffet. However, they will cook your eggs to order for you. The gentleman cooking the eggs this morning was great. Fast, friendly, and spot on with my eggs. He was very attentive to customers and everything going on at the buffet, especially in maintaining the quality of the food. Don’t forget to leave him a tip. The wait staff were all friendly and constantly cleaning something. People can complain, but it is a buffet. If you want everything cooked to order then order from the menu. Otherwise, understand that it is difficult to maintain “hot off the grill” food temperature from a buffet. 

No matter what other reviewers have said, this is the best Iron Skillet we have stoped at for breakfast. Maybe it was the workers, but I recommend this for breakfast. Especially if you are traveling and tired of the high carb free breakfast at your hotels. Fresh baked ham, sliced while you wait, bacon, sausage (more than one type), pancakes, French toast, eggs, hash browns, home fries, oatmeal, grits, biscuits, gravy, toast, English muffins, fresh fruits galore, and more.

Underwhelming,to say the least. Ordered the NY strip dinner. 
 Requested medium rare.  Came out medium well.  Next one came, and was raw.  The salad that I made was good.  The bowl of chicken soup that I replaced my steak with, could have come from a can.  The service was fantastic!  Definitely more training needed in the kitchen.
Ok food for cheap. All you can eat under 10$.  The best was the fresh omelet and fresh fruit. Rest ok. French Toast Hard and over cooked. Good and polite service

Stopped for lunch on the way to Albuquerque, decided to do the buffet. Should have just rummaged in the bar ditch along the highway for something to eat. Everything was cold or just lukewarm. Everything was incredibly bland. Fried pork chop had to be cut with the supplied steak knife and two hands, really tough. I found a couple of items I could eat so I could just get back on the road. I will not return here.

I stopped here on a whim with no idea what it would be like. Service was fast and attentive, and the food was unusually good. I had the chicken club sandwich, which is one of my favorites. This one was different from all the club sandwiches I have had in the past. The chicken was not in thin slices or chunks. Rather, it took the form of a half-inch thick fillet, very tender and tasty, that spread beyond the confines of the bread.

Plenty of room to park our RV outside. We loved the Iron Skillet and the Petro gift shop. Choices on the buffet were greatly to our liking. Wife did salads and fruits. I tried many other things. Nice sampling. Each were wonderful. Love the decoration of the cafe.

Nasty old looking buffet. So tried the green chili chicken fried steak. I should have been told that it was that hot. I eat green chili all the time and have never experienced it that hot. Had to return it.  They said get whatever you want off the buffet. Did I mention that was old and disgusting.  Waitress was the only good thing about the meal. Well as I said there's a good diner across the street.

Nice place to stop when you're on the road Foods OK little overpriced and if you're eating off the buffet if you don't get there when it's fresh it can be a little tough and we can try see a little bit but you're on the road so you're limited staff there a little slow at times it's not the first time that I've eaten here so I can say that
They want you in and they want you out even faster but she was nice about it-strange experience.    The buffet was dried up food and ordering off the menu was not  much better.
reviewTitle: Food is not fresh, service is rude

reviewText:
Appears to be your typical Truck Stop on the outside. You enter into the foyer with a large gift shop on one side and the diner on the other side. It was a "seat yourself" with plenty of available seating. (The restaurant was very busy approximately two thirds full) 
While we were sitting, our waitress introduced herself, delivered our menus and took our drink orders. Our coffee and my "sweet" tea was delivered while we were looking at the menus, The waitress took our order and it took approximately 1/4 of an hour for it to be served to us (impressive delivery time considering the large amount of customers) and during this time our drinks were never below 1/2.
We each ordered omelets which were served hot on metal "skillets". The omelettes were very good, & the American potatoes "with gravy on the side" was equally good. Generous portions so have a big appetite! 

Excellent service, good food
This Iron Skillet is like most any other one. Clean restaurant and restrooms. The food taste the same. The staff is pretty friendly. The is a safe choice. I have been here many times.
Food is giant portions of bland artery hardening fare.  Service is slow and inattentive.  Drink wasn't refilled timely and the overall atmosphere is rather depressing.
reviewTitle: Don't do it if you don't have to

reviewText: Mikayla’s Cafe is a great spot for anyone! My husband and I enjoyed breakfast there. The menu is plentiful and there are options for all tastes. The food was freshly prepared and delicious. We both had the Fitness Plate which suited our carb free, high protein needs perfectly.  It’s located in a strip of small restaurants but inside it’s very cute and very clean. Also the service was A+!
reviewTitle: Surprisingly cute place for great food, great service, and lots of choices for all tastes

reviewText: Great spot for a quick efficient and tasty breakfast. Family of 4 were seated quickly on a Saturday morning around 9am. Pancakes were anwesome and fell apart!  Eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, etc. all delicious. Crepes were the surprise hit. Yummy with a light Carmel sauce and tart apples. Coffee was just ok but we will be back next time we are in the area.
Went on a Monday around 1000 am.  Crowded.   Food, excellent service fast once greeted.   Price good.   Would go back and try other menu items.  Corned beef hash was great.

We just tried this new restaurant, and had a really nice breakfast. A great option now that prolific oven is closed. Lots of choices - three different kinds of French toast, crepes, scrambles, etc. Looks like they are only open until 2:30. But it's a clean, nice place to eat. They have large screen TV's that had the news on both walls.
What a great little breakfast spot. Really enjoyed my meal and the service was top notch. French toast and bacon were both delicious. I’ll be back next time I am in town.
reviewTitle: What a great little breakfast spot

reviewText: I did the keto platter, essentially 3 egg whites, Turkey & spinach, tomato slices with a side of sausage. It was quite tasty, made to order, reasonably quick. The Turkey was slice deli meat, and a tad pricey (but that's what you expect in Silicon Valley) at $20 (including a coffee).
I like egg Benedict but never had Mexican style! Nicer than i expected!! It was nice place for brunch! Coffee was just ok.
I got the breakfast crescent sandwich with a side of hash browns, and an iced coffee. This was a really great breakfast, not too heavy, and the coffee was refreshing!
Food was good and portions were large.  I ordered original chicken sandwich on Hawaiin rolls and it was delicious. Very casual place with small dining area.

We came here before an event this week.  I went here because they had great reviews.  I had a salad for breakfast.  For the amount and ingredients they put in it, it should have been $8- or $9-, but it was more than that.  Two of us had very simple meals with iced tea and mocha and it cost us over $43-.  It was the most expensive breakfast I've ever had in San Jose.  The guy who waited on us was very nice, but besides that, i would rather go somewhere else, even if it's right down the street from Levi Stadium.

A really nice breakfast option if you are visiting Santa Clara, less than 1 mile from Levi's Stadium. The bacon jam tacos on corn tortillas are excellent - you get three in an order. I liked the iced coffee too, but it was a little too sweet for my taste.

I ordered the simplest burger here because I just don't like them piled high with all sorts of stuff.  I just want to enjoy the meat with only a few other flavors.
I don't know how they season their burgers here but I enjoyed the novelty.  I will definitely eat here again if I'm in the neighborhood.
Garlic fries and iced tea were above average.
You can get a good brunch here - many options available and the prices were quite good. Surprisingly very busy and good value for money.
A nice small cafe. Good food selection. Very busy with pick up orders but didn't let that impact my good service.

Went here to get Early Bird and Vegeterian Country Skillet around 11 with a Friend. Needed to sit tight for almost 45 min for our request. We felt that eating inside would have taken less hold up time contrast with to-go. Keeping hold up time aside, nourishment was enjoyable  and quantity was good for a breakfast.
reviewTitle: A touch of Wait however food compensated for the time

reviewText: We discovered this cafe while staying at the Hyatt Regency and loved the selection of breakfast and lunch items. They offer healthy, decadent and creative foods that kids and adults will like.  The scramblers and eggs benedict that we tried were very good.  However, service is terrible.  Signs in the restaurant encourage you to order at the "front register" for faster service (there is no front register).  When we tried to order at the back register, they said they'd take our order at the table.  After taking our order and getting our food, we never saw our server again.  No drink refills.  No checking on our food.  No bill.  They seem understaffed.  Food was worth the visit, however.
reviewTitle: Great food.  Service?  Not so much.

reviewText: On my way for the convention center I stop for a breakfast, nice service although not precisely fast and good food. I had a good croissant French toast South Bay style

They lost my order. I had to wait an 45 minutes for a burger. Waiter didn't give me cutlery. The food was pretty bad. Then there was a 10 minute line to pay. I dont understand how a place like this exists.

Found this restaurant while vacationing in Santa Clara. We were impressed by the efficiency of service, and the quality and taste of the food. My sausage eggs benedict was a pleasant surprise - one of the best benedicts I have ever had at a restaurant! Definitely worth checking this place out.

We've tried hard to like this place.  It's near us and it's family run which is the type of business that is worth supporting.  Mikayla's has had no trouble filling the several tables so the people waiting outside seem to be a harbinger of trendiness.  It seems that the crowds are thinner now; no wait on a Sunday 10:15 am.

  You see little signs scattered among sports and random pictures on the wall telling you to get a table and then go to the cashier to order.  People might be too interested in their phone or company to notice.  It's an odd arrangement to say the least.  They may come out to take an order, they may not.  Either way, you place your order and wait for your meal that is actually table service.

  Weak service:  Forgot part of my guest's order, never refilled a coffee, never checked up on us and then you go stand in line to pay.  If you want a napkin or water, be prepared to get up and ask.  That falls a little (or a lot) short of full service.  Carl's Jr. is similar but doesn't presume a tip.

  Good food:  Not great but filling.  They serve one slice of toast, blackened.  The rest of the portions were better cooked and filled the plate.  The recipes are good, the execution is fair but I can't get past the notion that Mikayla's takes the customer for granted as they've got a location near the stadium without a whole lot of competition on that side of town.  Once the hype dies down and the regulars find another hot spot, we'll see if they can stay in business.
60 cent wing night! They were awesome! Service was excellent as well! We drove a long distance today and this place was great to relax and have good food and atmosphere

We ordered chicken fried steaks. There wasn’t enough gravy on the chicken fried steaks. The chicken fried steaks was really hard not tender. The salad bar was awesome. It was really good. The place was clean and the service was friendly.
Good happy hour specials,good Saldana bar,helpful staff reasonable prices..make this Good place to catch a good bite
reviewTitle: Much better than usual pib. Grrat dalabbar,good happy hour specials pleasant staff reasonable  overall good place to catch a nic

reviewText: We were traveling through Guyman just for the night. Found this restaurant on Trip Advisor.  Had 1.00 taco night and 3.00 margaritas.  Both were delicious.  Service was quick and the waitress was very helpful and polite.

Incredibly friendly service!! Good food. Interesting building. A very large menu so everyone can choose something they want. They really need a beer list with local or Oklahoma brewed beer. They need to pay attention to getting the labeled ladles in the right salad dressing. Overall, very happy.

Food was delicious, cooked according to requests and very large servings. The dinner rolls were just like homemade, delicious and yeasty. My steak was perfect and husbands chicken fried steak was gigantic. Nice salad bar to complement the entree. excellent and often checked on us. It was a Monday night and not very busy. When we left we noticed a sign that said for customers to go into the bar area. We were in a dining area, so maybe dependent on the amount of customers they utilize the space accordingly. Interesting sports decor.
reviewTitle: Suggested by check in desk at hotel. Great place!

reviewText: good menu selection and fast friendly service from Kaedyn K.  We did ask about the name of the restaurant as there was nothing to indicate why it was called the pub on the bricks, Kaedyn didn't know but found out and reported back to us.  Food was very reasonably priced and good.

This place is ok. Just ok. Atmosphere is stark and unremarkable. Food same. Waitress was friendly and pleasant, but when we asked what kind of beers they have, she said they change frequently. But there’s no way for us to know what to choose from.

Nice joint for a quick dinner. Husband said wrap was very good. I had fish and chips the was tasty. Fish and chips came w salad bar and it was great selection of things. Busy on Friday night. There is a bar in the back. I think they need more help. But was still good.

My daughter and I went here while passing through town.  We got the BLT and a burger.  BLT had a ton of bacon.  It could have used another slice of tomato, but it was still great.  Burger was big and tasty! Fries and homemade chips were delicious as well.  We will be back.
Nice place to get out of the car during a 12 hr trip. Sports bar type interior. Good variety on menu. We went for lunch and it was not loud or crowded.
reviewTitle: Good variety on the menu. Everyone in our party of 4 had something different and all liked what they got.

reviewText:
the restaurant was very noisy 
the food was cold for my husband who had taken a ribs my sandwich was not terrible just the beer was good and the peanuts
Just travelling through, and found this little place.  Staff were friendly and the food was good.  Basic bar food.  I would go again  if i  had the opportunity.

I have been here multiple times I eat there wings at least once a week most everything
 is good I  love it !

On the positive side, my daughter and I got the 50 cent wings, and they were very good.  I am not that picky about service, but this was too much.  My wife and I ordered a beer to start off.  When part of our order arrived, we had not yet received them (20-30) minutes.  When I pointed this out, she brought large ones when we order small. The waitress forgot my side order or fried okra, and no one ever brought us silverware, despite asking for it once our food arrived.  I noticed several other people having to get their wo n silverware as well.  How this place is ranked #2 is a mystery to me.
We found this here & stopped on our way through town. The food was excellent & served quickly. We would definitely stop by again.

Everything I have tried on the menu is delicious.  The service is as awesome as the food.  There is always a special for each day of the week.  Great  ambiance.  Always very clean.  In the front half of this establishment, it has an old time diner appeal to it and in the back there is a huge bar you can eat at with big screen t.v.'s and many other tables with bar stools to sit at.  Very comfortable atmosphere. Lots of available parking as well.  They have something for everyone, from young to old.
reviewTitle: Best restaurant in the state of Oklahoma.

reviewText: My friend and I went here after a long day of work that landed us in Guymon. He had a frozen strawberry margarita. I had a plain margarita on the rocks. Neither were very good. He ordered the ribeye and said it was bland. I ordered the sirloin. My steak was very tough and bland. We both agreed the salad bar was above average. The service was also pretty good. The steak and margaritas, especially the steaks, were very disappointing. If I wouldn’t have felt guilty for not eating the steak my Friend paid for, I wouldn’t have eaten more than a couple bites. Still yet, I didn’t finish it. I suppose I should’ve sent it back. Don’t order steak here!
reviewTitle: Tough steak. Nice salad bar. Crappy margarita.

reviewText: Great service and fantastic food as always! The servers are friendly and fast and the food is always some of the best in town.
I have ate almost everything on the menu and very rarely have I ate something that I did not like. They have a lot to choose from and catfish is very good. Burgers are small though for the price.

Güzel bir mekan mezeleri yemekleri hizmeti temizliği harikaydı servisteki herkes çok ilgiliydi masamızla Yigit kardeşimiz ilgilendi çok kibardı kendisine çok teşekkür ediyoruz tekrar görüşmek dileğiyle
The boy with glasses is very handsome and very polite, he delivered the order very quickly, we were very pleased and we are thinking of coming again.
the food was excellent and the waiter who wears glasses was very handsome.And the service was to good thanks for everything

Overpriced food of low quality was served by very an attentive server. We ordered five different dishes and all of them were below our expectations. The place seemed clean and spacious, but we were very disappointed overall as the food was not up to the par. We will not return to this restaurant.
reviewTitle: This place is not for foodies!

reviewText:
We had a great supper at Cinar in Cliffside Park on Saturday. The food and the service were good and the wait staff were friendly and attentive. I would recommend the lamb adana kebab for mains and the meatballs as a starter. Although we had reserved a table for 7 pm, upon arrival the restaurant asked if we could be done by 8.30 pm as they had an event scheduled for then. This did strike us a little odd, perhaps bordering on rude. This has never happened to me before. However, all went well and we were able to "leave on time". ?!  
If I go back I would like to try the baklava for dessert.
Very nice experience! Small and very cozy place! Very authentic Turkish food! For sure, a place to come back!
Everything was spot on. Service was warm and friendly, food was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Server was willing to listen and make recommendations based on our needs.
reviewTitle: Great flavors, great service, the whole package.

reviewText: I love Lebanese and Turkish food - they are similar. I had food in several Lebanese and Turkish restaurants. I was in that area and decided to visit based on reviews. I ordered a Shish Tawuk - chicken cubes with rice side. The chicken cubes were really juicy and tender - in several places it feels somewhat dry. I’d rate food at at 4.5. As some reviewers have noted there is only street parking. I also notice a lot of residential population visit - it got packed soon.
Excellent authentic decoration, fantastic Turkish foods served by very sympa people. Thank you 👍🍲🤓

Food is great quality.Try their combination platters you get to sample a little bit of everything.
Staff is even better.Always courteous and willing to accommodate your meal requests.

Situated in a small place in a residential neighborhood of Cliffside Park, the restaurant has some good original Turkish foods that are worhty the visit. If you enjoy having some drinks, make sure to bring some of your own. We brought some wine bottles and this very kind hostess provided us with the glasses. Awesome place!

My brother and his family were visiting from Dakota.  They had never been to a Turkish restaurant. There are none in Dakota.  They wanted to try new things and my wife and I love Cinar. My brother and his family absolutely loved the food!!! There are a lot of Turkish restaurants in the Cliffside/Fairview area.  My wife and I have tried most of them and I still maintain that this is one of the best.

The food and the service were both excellent.   The atmosphere is nice: clean, comfortable, cozy, and casual.  The only problem is that there is no parking lot and the steet parking can be hard to find.
The shepherd salad was excellent, the service poor and the food dry and tasteless. Don’t waste your time or money.
Just has a fabulous meal at the very authentic Turkish restaurant. Excellent service with top quality ingredients in the dishes served.

We were a group of 10 people and had visited to celebrate a birthday...the staff attitude completely sucked...they did not even cut the birthday cake for us...and were really rude and haughty during every interaction...

They did not even offer tea for a second time... despite asking...

Food was really bland...nothing to comment on...

Nothing fancy about, just good, friendly casual Turkish food with a very good menu. Portions are good size and the service is on point.  Cinar offer a family friendly environment but you won't go wrong bringing a date here.

I've had sit down dinners and have ordered delivery from this place and it's great every time.  I recently ordered the falafel plate for delivery and it arrived hot and fresh.  The salads are fresh and the hummus tastes homemade.  Prices are not the cheapest, but it's definitely worth the money!

We had dinner for four on a Saturday evening  and everything we ordered was very good. The service and atmosphere was very good as well. . We were able to park on the street right in front of the restaurant.
reviewTitle: Very good service, very good food

reviewText: We were 4 adults with a baby and went here for dinner on a Saturday night.  The staff were very pleasant and accomodating.  We enjoyed the chicken and vegetable soup and grilled eggplant spread as appetizers.  We sampled the stuffed eggplant, lamb shish kebab and adana kebabs.  All were delicious.  We also enjoyed a custard (similar to flan) and the kadayif (sweet cheese pastry).  Overall a great experience and we will be back on our next visit to Cliffside Park.
What a nice place to eat , good food and the staff are so friendly and we're so helpful with all our tourist questions .  We had the loaded potato soup which was delicious.

We held our welcome party before our wedding at Wynkoop. We could not have asked for a better experience. The team was responsive and really easy to work with, price wise they were very reasonable, space was beautiful, and staff was amazing. I would recommend Wynkoop for anyone looking to host an event!

Before catching a bus back to Boulder, we stopped here for drinks in the evening. It was not that crowded, and very comfy. We also ordered a pretzel, and it was really good. Just a little pricey here, but otherwise really good!
reviewTitle: Great Place for Happy Hour in Denver

reviewText: Truly outstanding. Each beer was better than the last with the South Park calob, 'Merica Pale Ale, taking the gold! Wife had the adult mac and cheese which was amazing and I had the fish and chips which were perfectly crispy and flaky. Hats off to the entire staff and brewmaster. I can't recommend Wynkoop enough.
Do NOT get their Mac-and-Cheese, it is a large waste of money, has nearly no taste, and no cheese. 0/10 would not recommend ever getting it
Good beer but they do charge a rip off 3.5% junk fee so be aware. But I just deducted off the tip so no sweat off my back. But be aware of this rip off junk fee when visiting.
reviewTitle: Good beer but be aware of rip off junk fee

reviewText: When we arrived, we were advised that there were no open tables, but bar seating might be available. We didn’t see any open seats upstairs, but found several open chairs at the much larger bar on the main floor. Our bartender was very pleasant, and we decided to order the green chili fries with pork shoulder ($5 up charge). The food was actually pretty good with plenty of the tender pork, but there didn’t appear to be much of the green chili. I tried two beers - Patty’s chili beer and The Devil Wears Flannel. Both were decent ($8 each) but probably nothing that I would order again. Be aware that this place adds a 3.5% surcharge to help pay the non-tipped employees. I definitely consider this practice to be underhanded and would prefer that their prices be set at whatever is needed to pay the staff.

I want to give credit when it's due. And to the credit of Wynkoop Brewing (WB), it doesn't over-promise. It's a brew pub, with all the usual brew pub foods and drink. And while my wife and I dined there, we were surrounded by people for whom WB was perfect, because they were all grabbing a quick dinner before departing for the Avalanche hockey game at Ball Arena. (Quick aside: WB is perfectly located for pre- and post-game fans of every Denver pro team--though the Broncos are a bit of a hike.) What's more, the restaurant occupies the east wing of Denver's gorgeously restored Union Station, which benefits WB to the tune of a 3-story high ceiling and wonderful feeling of spaciousness and light. Also quite pleasant is the monetary bottom line: $101 for the two of us, including all taxes and fees, cocktail and wine, and 25% tip to our very competent and wise-cracking server. So WB isn't greatest, greater, or even great. But it's ideal for the many people who want an extensive menu at some of the lowest prices in the restaurant-rich downtown Denver LoDo neighborhood .
reviewTitle: Uh ... it's not the greatest. And not greater. ... Or great. BUT CHEAP! And worth it!

reviewText: Was heading over to the Market street food court when my spouse and I decided to try Wynkoop.  This turned-out to be a great choice.  Though it's only pub food, the quality was well above average and at a fair price.  The wait staff were very friendly and attentive.  Definitely a repeat visit upon my return visit to Denver.
We came here for a beer tasting tour.  All of the beers that we tried were really good.  In fact, I would recommend the rocky mountain oyster beer.  The pretzel with cheese was really good too!

Several years ago I travelled to Denver for the first time and had beer and dinner at the Wynkoop. I recently came back for a work trip and this was the one place I knew I wanted to stop for dinner and drinks. It didn't disappoint. I decided to give the vegetarian shepherds pie a try. It was delicious. Hearty. A bit on the small side, but the price wasn't terrible. For beer, I tried the Wobbling Monk from the house and a milk stout from another brewery. Both were amazing. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have their Rocky Mountain oyster stout this time, but look out for it. It's good too. The Wynkoop is a great location. Right downtown near Union Station and the baseball stadium. Check it out.

We visited Wynkoop Brewing Company twice during our time in Denver.  Very easy to find, a short walk from Union Station.  Several good beers on tap and delicious wings and fries.  A bit disappointed in the Nashville hot chicken sandwich though...just hot sauce poured on top of the chicken.  Loved the atmosphere and will visit again the next time I am in Denver.  Restrooms are down a flight of stairs in the basement.  
Good and friendly service.  3% service charge added to bill for kitchen staff.
We enjoyed our dinner here.  They brew some nice beers and the food menu has enough options for everyone.  They don’t take reservations but the place is large and we didn’t have a wait.

Went here late Saturday Morning, they were just opening up and we were the third pair of guests. We sat outdoor, and before it was 12pm half the terrace was full already. We ordered a 5-sampler platter, bison burger, sweet potato waffle fries, coleslaw and a (Saturday/Sunday only available) Avocado toast with herb cream cheese. The food looked remarkably well. And the taste was the same. High quality comfort food. They checked in on us on regular occasion. We enjoyed the time here and continued our journey with a full stomach.
reviewTitle: Great comfort food and craft beers

reviewText: Nice patio and super kind staff. I’m not the biggest beer drinker, but my husband got some good ones in a flight. I would go back!
Cool staff serving some of the best beer in the city in a good location in a historic building. Prices were average but considering the quality of the beer I wasn't complaining.

I ordered food from the bartender. I tipped him 20% on my credit card, and when I checked my credit card statement later, I noticed that he added an additional $20 to my tip without my permission. I’m bummed because the food was pretty good, but I certainly wouldn’t advise anyone to eat here, or at least I would suggest paying cash so you don’t get hit by the tip scam. This has happened to me at other restaurants before so I always make sure to double check that the waiter/bartender doesn’t add an unauthorized tip. It’s a shame to see dishonesty like this.
reviewTitle: SCAM ALERT: Bartenders add money to your tip after you pay with credit card

reviewText: Great food. Enjoyed the Buffalo chicken sandwich and companion had a grilled salmon on a salad. Their beer was awesome, we had their lager and a cider. Would recommend for a meal or drink. Great and timely brewery.
reviewTitle: A good spot for a bite to eat and brew

reviewText: Stopped by for drinks - had a ‘flight’ of 4 to sample and all were good. Good service at the bar - helpful, informative and friendly

On our way to ball game tonight stopped for dinner at Wynkoop. I had their Cheese Steak with Sweet Potato Waffle Fries. I would have preferred a roll with less bulk since there was a lot to eat. My spouse had a Beef Burger with Swiss Cheese and our daughter had the Beef Burger with Cheddar Cheese. Both enjoyed their sandwiches, We also enjoyed their Wixa Weiss beer with our dinner. Service was prompt and the food very tasty.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Very cozy and welcoming little cafe, I've been coming here for years.  I love their drinks.  Most recently, I got the caramel frappe, and that was lovely.  The empanadas are delicious, especially the brisket one.  And the desserts. . . . I ordered dulce de leche birthday cakes here before, and I highly recommend those.   For smaller, individual desserts, I can recommend the chocolate covered dulce de leche tart, or the Killer (layers of pastry dough, dulce de leche, and meringue).

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Stopped on a whim. The empanadas were excellent and it was the BEST caramel frappucino I've ever had. The pastries were great as was the service. Great place.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
This place is relaxing with a pleasant atmosphere and a hidden jewel close to DFW airport. Good for small business meetings. Or just enjoy a coffee with someone or like in today's case a tea solo.
The one mayor issue is that the pastries are the best around here and it's impossible to stay away from them. It would even be a sin.
even if you're trying to loss weight 
YOU NEED TO TRY THEM or the cakes.
Hope you enjoy this place. As I do.
reviewTitle: Relaxing, pleasant with one mayor issue...

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Found this wonderful place in a non-discreet open air mall. Coffee was excellent as well as the pastries. Enormous variety of international flavors. Will come back.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Okay, granted there's not alot of competition in DFW area for Argentinean goodies .... I was very pleased with their empanadas and various pastries.  This is a small cafe, so come here if you want an empanada and/or baked goods.  Also have sandwiches on menu however really didn't pay attention as that wasn't my focus.  ALSO, this may be only place (that I'm aware of) selling alfajores .... they both make their own as well as sell a brand (Terrabusi).  Altho not the Havanna brand, I thought the Terrabusi alfajores were about as good.  Lastly I tried one of their pastries called a 'cornita' .... omg, delicious!
reviewTitle: Empanada lovers - get thee to Argentina Bakery in Irving!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I loved this place with its mounds of cookies and pastries which were all delicious. I tried quite a few of them, but in my haste I failed to take note of their names. Their coffee was good too but the Maté fell flat which someplace that specializes in Argentinian cuisine should be able to handle. But that had great empanadas to compensate. I went their every day of my trip to the DFW area.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: We tried a number of pastries, empanadas, coffee, & cocoa. I love this place! Every bite was savored & I am only sad that I don't live nearby. This will forever be a DFW stop for us from now on. All was delicious! Stop here for sweets that are not too sweet unlike American bakeries.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
This is one of my all time favorites bakery located in the heart of Irving. I love all of their delightful, tasteful & delicious savory pastries and snacks. The bakers seem to have mastered their baking skills unique to Latin America, which is very well reflected in what they serve. Their wide variety of pastries are moist and rich, but not like American or European extra rich, with the perfect combination to fulfill anyone's indulgence. 

Ordered a birthday cake from here and received many compliments! The ambience is very cozy and uniquely Latin or European cafe like! Great comfortable interior for coffee, pastry and get together with friends, family or loved ones!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I just happened to pass by this bakery and out of curiosity i went inside and found out they have a lot of selections of cakes 🎂, pies, pastries and empanadas. I ordered a frappe and coconut tart and it was good..  the coffee ☕️ house is small but overall my first visit was good 😊..

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
I have been wanting to find a good place to buy empanadas, luckily I finally have!
My husband and I have just arrived at DFW airport and wanted something easy to carry out to take home.  Because I had to make a quick stop at a Tuesday Morning... we lucked out. This place is right next to the TM at the corner of Beltline and 183.  We ordered beef, ham/cheese and spinach empanadas. All three were great! We also tried their fruit tart and a cookie assortment from the bakery and loved them all.  This is definitely a fantastic place for carry out as well as to eat in. Nice place to meet for coffee.  Very courteous service.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: A grand surprise. Wonderful pastries and empanadas. Favorites were the ricotta tart and the ham and cheeses empanada. Coffee is robust and modestly priced. My second trip and empanadas showed a consistent flavor and marvelous crust. Took a few home --- reheated ham and cheese for @23 seconds in microwave, turned out great.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Heard about this place and sauntered in one Sunday morning.     Incredible!!   Wonderful looking cakes and empanadas.  The seating area is small but comfortable.  I liked the cans of Diet Coke (all Soda in cans actually).   The cream on the cakes is always fresh with a good variety of empanadas - including an offer to make custom versions too.   Highly recommended.    Best cake store I have seen or found in DFW.  Try it out!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Sad to report that I finally found a place that provide delicious and scrumptious desserts, but the place really needs cleaning.  Probably we visited late in the day and the servers were tired.  Those beautiful glass counters were loaded with fingerprint stains and tables and chairs were dirty.
reviewTitle: Scrumptious Dessert But Place Needs Cleaning

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Loved this awesome little coffee shop off 183 and Beltline in Irving!!  The Latte was good. The pastries were amazing! Great coffee shop atmosphere inside, with little tables covered outside. And the salsa music in the background just added to the fun! The empanadas are wonderfully delicate and flavorful!! We tried the spinach egg and cheese, brisket, and the beef empanadas. Empanadas were small, $1.99 each , and worth every penny! The ground beef had such a wonderful South American seasoning! So so good! I will be back to try all the empanadas and all the amazing looking pastries, too!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
I'm a regular visitor to this bakery to indulge in their mouthwatering and magnificent pastries and flavorful snacks,  and it always has been a delightful visit! 

Ordered a caramel and cream cake for my sons birthday and everyone loved it! Will visit here again!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Lots of good looking desserts, with good coffee to complement the sweets.  Also sells Argentine grocery items (small selection, reminds people of home).

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I am from Argentina, so I had to go visit them. The place is really nice, it has a sitting area. They have a lot of Argentine goodies, I think I bought one of each! They were really really good, I felt like I was at home again. I totally recommend them.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
Every time I stop in here I get immediately transported to Argentina. The food selection is exactly like you would see in the country.  Empanadas ( horno solamente) are tasty with several varieties baked and ready to consume.  The coffee is just how I like it while in S A.

Go out of your way.  You will enjoy an escape 5000 miles away in your own back yard. most likely because the owner is from Mendoza!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I discovered this place shortly after I moved to Irving seven years ago.  The food and pastries are delicious, and their Mayan Mocha is wonderful.  If they were on my way to work, I would be stopping there every day.  The interior is comfortable and the music they play is enjoyable.  Also, the staff is always friendly.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
I found this place on Tripadvisor and decided to check it out. A beautiful small little bakery near the Irving Mall. The location was little off and not best place, but once you are inside it was a beautiful place and very inviting. 

I tried a mix of most of the Pastries on offer and the representative at the store was very helpful. Also tried the Flan (Mango Flan) it was very very delightful. 

I would have given 5 stars for this place based on taste but going with 4 stars for the location and the prices (which I feel are a little on the expensive side). 

I will surely recommend this place though.
reviewTitle: One of the best Bakeries in DFW

reviewText:
This place has food so delicious. We dine there usually twice a month.
We also went to try their new location and i must say they fulfilled my expectations.
We came food was served perfectly. Appetizers so good. Everything was served in a timely manner. Staff friendly and helpfull.
Great place to take a date or family for diner.

This was not the first time we ate here, but it will probably be the last. First of all, there was no a/c. With outside temperatures over 90 degrees and high humidity, they had the door open for some ventilation. It did not work...
At 6pm, the restaurant was not full, a few occupied tables, a few empty. But we were so rushed, and I really don't understand why.
We sat down, ordered in a few minutes, then appetizers arrived right away. We were still eating them, when less than 10 minutes later they came to clean up the table because the entrees were ready. The appetizers were good, and we had to ask for a few more minutes to finish them. They literally gave us a couple more minutes, then entrees arrived, we ate...and that was it. We did not want desert, so check came and we were out in less than 45 minutes. 
This was a birthday dinner on a Saturday night, so we hoped to be able to enjoy the company of our friends, chat some, not feel kicked out like this. Very disappointed.
Went to Cinar for first time in January for a friend's birthday. Food and service was great and I found out they deliver! Delivery now part of my weekly routine!

This restaurant was suggested by a cab driver. We were glad we decided to follow the advice. Nice place with an interesting decor. Good appetizers. The Adana Kebob was awesome. Service was prompt. Will definitely return if we are ever in this area again.
Let's keep this short and sweet-- GO TO THIS RESTAURANT. The fried calamari was amazing, the Adana kebab was amazing (and large), and the baklava was delicious. Also it's BYOB.
reviewTitle: Best Turkish food I've ever had

reviewText:
My wife and I frequently eat Turkish/Mid-Eastern Food.
On our way back from New York Yesterday we decided to try Cinar for the first time. We have dined at numerous restaurants in the area and Cinar set a new standard.
Service: Prompt, polite and pleasant. Always available without being overbearing.
Decor - Makes the best of a challenging environment. Attractive without being too cusey.
Food: The Main event. Opening with the Cinar and a Spicy salad, both lip smacking and a meal unto themselves. Accompanied by fresh warm bread (already a winner). The main dishes were:
Turkish Dumplings Manti
A light dough stuffed with ground lamb and onions steamed to perfection, served with seasonings and garlic yogurt sauce. ASK FOR EXTRA GARLIC
Absolutely amazing!
Ali Nazik
Smoked eggplant puree with ground lamb and garlic yogurt.
EXTRA GARLIC and we had the shish instead of ground lamb. 
Finished off with the custard dessert.
The only shame is that we didn't have more room to try more. We will have to go back with friends, Many times!
Enjoy

ニュージャージーでちゃんとしたトルコ料理店！
現地の味、雰囲気をよく作られていた。
また次回もお世話になりたいお店
reviewTitle: 間違いないトルコ料理

reviewText: This is seriously one of the best restaurants I've been to. It's not ultra fine dining, 3 Michelin stars, book 3 months in advance type of deal. But, the food is pretty authentic and its amazing. Just absolutely amazing. Everything off the grill is just so juicy and tender and wonderful. The lamb shank, for example, doesn't need a knife! The meat just slides of the bone with a fork! What more can you ask for? Hurry in and try this place!!!
Great food and service. BYO. Waiters/waitresses helpful and pleasant. Eaten there several times and never been disappointed
Excellent Adana kabab and rocca salad. Average setting and decor. Chonan salad was not the best nor the stuffed grape leaves. Will definitely give it another try

We were in the mood for a quick lunch and dropped by to check out Cinar which a friend had highly recommended. The lunch was even better than expected. My Shepherd Salad was one of the best I had ever tasted. My husband gave rave reviews to the Mushroom Casserole (mantar guvec). This is now on our "favorites" list.

I have travelled to many places in the world, have tried several cuisines and flavors. Cinar's chef deserves the credit for one of the best appetizers both hot and cold in the area. Having lived in the vicinity for over 2 decades, this is one of the best mediterranean eateries where they do not use mayo for baba ganoush and their calamari is excellent with unique condiments that surpass any other restaurants. I always order the lentil soul and calamari. The turkish tea is excellent as well. Everything I have tried here from appetizers to entrees' has been a delicious experience. The service and hostess are above average. The location is cute and the ambience is lovely.One of the best in metro NY. Highly recommended and well priced.
reviewTitle: The best Calamari in metro NY

reviewText:
It's been too long since I was able to taste the magnificent flavor of midye dolma. These delectable morsels were served to me by head Chef Serhat Asik, a 2-star Guide Michelin chef, who ordered them delivered fresh, steamed them, made the rice with his signature spice blend and put them in front of me for lunch.
If you've never had midye (OK, don't go to Google, it's steamed mussels with spiced rice, served cold) this is the place. Tunc Ozlu, the owner, brought over a Niçoise with some of the tastiest shrimp I've had all month. Sorry, I eat my weight in shrimp every 2 months. These shrimp were tender and gently spiced but sweet to the tongue.
The other dish I tasted was a poached salmon over slices of red beets that was so tender you didn't need teeth. I like red beets so they all went down the craw.
When my Turkish coffee was ready, Celik, our attentive server brought a sour cherry tart and a blueberry tart, both which are baked daily at Tunc's Divan Cafe, only 4 doors south.
The deeply rich and sweet demi tasse was sipped in between bites of those tarts. Deciding which was better was like picking a favorite child. OK, the blueberry was sweeter.
If you go, parking is treasure in Cliffside Park so if you can't find a spot in front there's usually a side street available. BYOB and an appetite for adventure. Tunc claims he makes the best adana in all of New Jersey so...
reviewTitle: Stuff you can't usually get at a Turkish restaurant

reviewText:
This out of the way place is in a row of interesting dining places.   This one really had a great couple of dishes and a very nicely done interior for a not very fancy location. (The nearby Lebanese place is also very good!)

The adana kebob which is a signature kind of dish was perfectly prepared and presented.  The 3 appetizers were very good and fresh, nothing seemed like it had been hanging around  the kitchen and brought back to life. Make sure you try the arugula salad with currante...nice!  Side dishes were fresh and prepared with care including a red onion, cucumber, type salad.  

We didn't have it but there was a beautiful looking whole fish dish that would be a must if you're a true seafood fan.  The okra was also nice, but simple. Bread fresh and warm.  Service was polite and well done ( only a few customers ). No annoying music;  a nice place with good subtle lighting, nice aesthetics, etc.
