Though we didn't sample a whole lot of the menu, I trust it would be a very good experience all around.
reviewTitle: Really nice vibe and dishes well executed

reviewText:
Great experience on a brewery. Good choice of local beers. 
Good food (for the kind).
Good service. No expresso, but regular coffee.
Location and staff help to the overall satisfaction. A good choice for a different option.
reviewTitle: Nice for a lunch on a brewery

reviewText: Stopped in quick for a beer and an appetizer to share. Server was incredibly friendly and stopped to chat for a few minutes.  Beers were good and split the pretzel.  Normally not big into mustard but theirs was excellent.   Very good outdoor seating with shade.
Stopped here for dinner with my wife. Great service, nice selection of beer, and good food too! Would recommend the Bison Burger and Kurt's Mile High beer. Both were great.
reviewTitle: Nice Place for a Beer and Dinner

reviewText: We really enjoy wynkoop. It has turned into kind of a old time historic destination. The service was pretty slow, they seemed to be short staffed. The beer was ok.
reviewTitle: We always enjoy a stop at Wynkoop.

reviewText: Enjoyed fantastic beer here. My favorite beer was the Hazy Train IPA. Also very good beef burger. Friendly staff and great that you here can see how they brew.

super fun place gather a crowd for a meet and great.  waitstaff kept drinks flowing.  nice bbq buffet.  had access to pool tables and other activities.  so close to the train station and the hotels around the station.  such a wonderful time was had by all.

Decided to fuel up before we took A train to DIA airport. The location is perfect, right by Union Station. The burgers and fries were very good and perfectly prepared! Our waitress was nice and efficient! And even though we made it clear we were in a hurry, the service was fantastic and they even gave drink refills! Would definitely recommend!

They make their own beer, which was a small selection but a good range of IPAs for different palates. We had a Hefeweizen and a sour, both very good. My bison burger was solid, and I upgraded to sweet potato fries which were excellent.  A small surprise was a $1 charge to make it a cheeseburger. Unfortunately my wife’s tuna tartare was a big disappointment to her. We split a wedge salad which was very large and pretty tasty. The whole thing ran us about $75 so you’re paying a little more for location.
reviewTitle: Decent food, great beer, a little pricey

reviewText: After ending the free walking tour of downtown Denver at Union Station, we stopped here because it was across the street and was recommended by someone.  My husband ordered the shrimp po' boy sandwich and some beers.  The sandwich was good with ample amount of shrimp and very thick (too much, had to tear some off) bread.  The service was efficient except that it took a bit long to check out and pay.
reviewTitle: good lunch option across from Union Station

reviewText:
Really enjoyed my brew and burger here.
No real WOW factor , but beer was good and
Burger was inexpensive and tasty. Just felt
It was rather stuck in the 80s and nothing 
Really stood out . Thankfully , did not want a Tee
Shirt as the gift nook was rather barren.
Nothing bad , just felt it could be a little better .

My wife and I went to Wynkoop recently while on vacation in Denver.  It was a great choice.  We went for lunch on a Sunday.  We were able to sit outside in large area which was great because it was a very nice day.  We started with the queso/salsa and chips.  Both were excellent.  My wife had the green chicken chile.  She loved it but large portion for bowl but great stuff.  I had the fish and chips and excellent.  Great service and selection of beers and cocktails.  Great experience and highly recommend.

We wanted to eat outside but not necessarily on the street. This restaurant along with a few along this route, has a elevated outdoor eating area (inside too) which fit the bill. Our server, Brittni was wonderful. We were in the mood for nachos so we each got a plate with a cup of green chili to top them off. Hubby had a beer called "Move Your Car." He loves craft beers and was in quite the dilemma choosing from beers at this brewing company.

A brew restaurants like many towns have. An old building with great food and service.  Nothing fancy but  lots of good food. Wife had ribs which come with everything under the sun. Not the fastest service I have ever had but I would return in a heartbeat if I was in the area. Very near Coirs Field.
reviewTitle: Lots of good food and happy servers

reviewText: We stopped here for a late lunch due to the location and it looked kind of lively on a mid-week mid-afternoon day. They were "out of" the chicken parm sandwich, and waitress recommended the traditional one. Chicken patty was large and skin was super thick and cooked until it was a rock hard. Not great. Service was very slow, as seems to be the case at many places these days due to staff issues.
Great location in LoDo to try some local brews. Patio seating was nice. Limited food options for vegetarians.

The beer and food are always.good but is it enough ? Not always. I had not been in awhile so on the way to the airport, I stopped. The service was below par and they were not that that busy at 6 p.m. The waitress did not seem invested in me being there and displayed a tart attitude. She tried to make up for it but it was too late. I had the Mile High Beer and it was delish. My entree was fish and chips which is a favorite of mine. Hopefully, by the end of the year more options, better service, and better ambiance will show.

We wanted to visit the oldest brewpub in Denver. We found our server great but the beer pretty traditional and not as interesting as many other breweries these days. We wanted to try the one different beer—yam beer— but they were out.

Came here for some drinks yesterday and we were seated outside as it was a beautiful day. We had beer flights and a few shots, everything was great and out server was super nice and accommodating. Will be returning!
Visited from Florida. Awesome selection of beer and tasty food. In a convenient location as well. It’s close to Union Station.
Very good. Ate here while here on a trip to TEX from ATL. Great brews and a chill atmosphere. Keep it up!

You have got to go visit this place for ice cream and crêpes. I had the #3 and it was out of this world. Clean, friendly service, and great atmosphere. Highly impressed by the owner’s interaction with the customers.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I worked from here for a few hours and had excellent coffee and a pastry. Everything was very good and the service provided was great. I would easily work here again.
reviewTitle: Excellent for a coffee and a pastry

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Have been going there for a year great food..Recently visited at a lunch time around 11;30am bad service dirty dishes had to tell employee to wash the utensil  before trying to use it on my frappe.note to owner  please look into this.My spinach empanadas were burnt spinach was so dry.Your employees can make you or break you Went there August 19,2015

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
I wish I knew about this place sooner. Argentina Bakery is an amazing little cafe.  They have a very good selection of sweets including some I have only ever found in South America or Spain.  My favorite by far are the polvorones especially with a nice latte.  

They also have some excellent empanadas: beef with egg, beef and jalapeños, chicken, and ham and cheese.  The chicken are my favorite.  I normally go for beef empanadas, but you really should try their chicken empanadas.

Argentina Bakery also sells a small selection of groceries such as mate, dulce de leche and morcilla.  In fact this is the only place I have been able to find morcilla in DFW.

I cannot not recommend this place enough.  If you are in DFW you really should stop by Argentina Bakery.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Argentina Bakery is a very special and unique place in Irving. When I lived in Irving, I would frequent this bakery on special evenings for a desert or on a weekend for breakfast. Now that I live out of town, whenever I am in the Irving/Dallas area, I always try to stop buy. Their delicious empanadas, fresh pastries, and special deserts that are lightly sweet are some of my favorite items to order. Truly a unique find in Irving, Texas!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: The Argentina Bakery is another of Irving's best kept secrets. The cakes & pastries are amazingly beautiful & delicious. The cappuccino is the best I've had since Del Mar, CA. However, the empanadas are better than the ones I had in Buenos Aires. The Bakery & Coffee House is small & quiet. Not a bad place for a late lunch & a book. A great place to meet a friend. They also have free wifi. But, honestly... I hope nobody reads this & nobody goes. I like my quiet little spot to go for a late lunch & a book. (Maybe they'll open another out by the new Half Price Book Store.)

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Es una pequeña embajada de sabor argentino matutino. Íbamos en búsqueda de un Starbucks y nos encontramos con este cafecito. Aunque no son tan rápidos y efectivos como lo es el Starbucks, se compensa con la variedad y el sabor de la repostería y panadería. Muy recomendable.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: Amazing.  A rare find in the metroplex.  Reminds me of the coffee houses in South Korea.  Love it and will be back.  Everyone must try a sweet here

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: This has become a regular stop in our week. The coffee is consistently good- the best in town.  We haven't tried everything, but everything we did try has been as good as it looks!  The empanadas have perfect flakey pastry.  I am getting hungry thinking about them!
reviewTitle: Good coffee, good empanadas, good sweets every day!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I was able to get several finger foods, such as pastries and empanadas, to take to an outdoor concert at the Botanical Gardens in Ft. Worth. My group loved each one of the various types I brought. I will return any time I need something tasty for a group or myself.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
Cakes are delicious and they have a lot of Argentinian specialists.
Coffee is good as well. They sell also Argentinian products

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
This place is a hidden gem.   The coffee is excellent and there are not enough visits to try everything in the case,  If you are into leche cake or other authentic Argentinian pastry this is the place.  

It is not easy to find but worth the effort.  It is behind the Target and if you are fan of Tuesday Morning make this a two stop event.  After some serous bargain hunting reward yourself with an expresso or cappuccino and make sure to try the brisket empanadas.
reviewTitle: If you want a real pastery to go with great coffee -this is the place

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: The best empanadas in the Dallas area and a comfortable place to relax with a coffee and a sweet. A great place to be.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: This little gem of a place was just great. Many things to choose from, pastries, cakes, fruit tartlets, empanadas, coffee, sandwiches. The empanadas had a flaky outside, like a filo. Our favorite was the beef and jalapeño. We got half a dozen of those fresh to eat on the ride back home to TN and started on them in the parking lot... They were so good. The chicken empanadas were also good. The brisket empanadas was good. The only one we didn't love was the spinach, but it wasn't necessarily their fault. It was just straight strong spinach, as opposed to the creamy light tasting spinach dishes unusually eat. If you really like plain ole spinach then these are for you. We got several things from the pastry cases that I don't remember the name of, one that was particularly fabulous was a shortbread cookie with a fruit (jam) type center and a dusting of powdered sugar. Holy cow. The little fruit tarts were very good also. Hope we get a chance to patron this establishment again one day.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: This place is incredible! From the moment you walk in, you will be pleased! Fresh cakes and gateau galore, fruit tarts, and so many pasteries! Everything is fresh! I would go back in a heart beat!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: It is hard to find a non-Starbucks cafe in Irving.  This one is great with wi-fi, good coffee, and pretty tasty empanadas if you are not in the mood for sweets.

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: The Empenadas (a baked meat pie that looks like a pastry) is the star to me. Never can decide between the chicken or beef, so get both. My son likes the little sandwiches in Saran wrap. This place is always clean, and very comfortable. We go get lunch and bring back besitos for the office. Super good coffee drinks, expresso, etc. I like the Cafe Americano decaf. This is a casual place, order at the counter.  Many, many choices of desserts and pastries.  Great for breakfast or lunch. Worth a detour.
reviewTitle: Me and my whole company staff love Argentina Bakery

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: I been coming to this place since they've opened. Everything they have here from the coffee and tea, pastries, cakes and the famous speciality "the empanadas" are just great mouth watering.Is a small cozy place with a small seating area. comfortable and wi-fi is free, nice to come and chat with the friends, however and wont recomended for families with kid's (specialy on th eweekends when is crowded) They have a great assosrtment of coffee and tea for sale,Also try the fresh bread they have on a daily basis. 200% RECOMENDED!!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
We visit almost weekly with my husband and daughter. For years we were looking for a bakery experience like I grew up with in Europe, and this, oddly enough, comes very close. From the first time we found it, we knew this would be a great place. A small bakery-cafe, with limited items imported from Argentina for sale (a variety of mate and related items, spices, coffee, a case full of bread and imported sausages), an array of coffee and tea drinks, empanadas and, of course, the ever-growing variety of desserts. Lately they added an extra case for cupcakes and cake balls to go with the current fad in dessertdom, and business-wise it was a very shrewd decision. I always choose from their original items, but my daughter got swayed by the cherry-topped cupcakes once or twice.
The interior is great, always decorated according to season and comfy, with its big inviting leather chairs on the side begging to spend a couple of hours reading or catching up on e-mail, and the more traditional chair-and-table arrangements in the middle and a couple of chairs outside. The line of glass cases as you enter holds a bewildering array of sweets, cakes and desserts. A lot of them are made with dulce de leche, which I personally find a bit too sweet, but most Americans should have no problems with it. I normally end up with one of the Piononos--cake rolls filled with fruit jam and either dusted with sugar or coconut, or covered in chocolate. Their tiramisu cake is surprisingly light and authentic-tasting, while their Eclair is one of the best I've sampled in the metroplex.
The empanadas are fresh and baked on site behind the counter:  try the beef with jalapeno (delightfully spicy with the little pieces of egg countering the sharpness of the jalapenos perfectly), or the spinach-ricotta (soft cheese and pepper-studded chopped spinach, yum!). My little one's favorite is the simple Ham &Cheese.
The coffee is fresh, and the large earthenware mugs are great to hold and sip from while looking around and listening to the other patrons and the soft music. This is not pretentious or artsy, there's no weird wibe or flashy baristas: they just, simply, give you a slice of a culture that, in my opinion, should feature more in our everyday life.
Try it.
reviewTitle: A cozy place to rest and  relax

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText:
This is a small bakery with tons of things to choose from! I always go for the empanadas and 2 or 3 of them is enough for me to get full! 

My favorites are the Ham & Cheese and Spinach and Cheese.  They have coffee and tea for sale and an assortment of amazing pastries most of them made with Dulce de Leche. 

You can also order the empanadas by the doze ahead of time! Definitely a must!

placeAddress: 3401 W Airport Fwy Ste 112, Irving, TX 75062-5931
reviewText: We decided to go here because of all the great reviews we found on line.  We order 4 different pastries to share (my husband and myself) and they were moist, fresh and delicious. This is a bakery, coffee house and mini Argentina store. It was fun and the owner helped us pick out our treats. Will definitely go back!
reviewTitle: This was an amazing bakery full of delicious treats for all

reviewText: I found this location off a mapping gps app while waiting for an evening post dinner business meeting. The decor was nice with exposed brick & beam. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly. I had sliders and an adult beverage. It a location I would visit again if in Guymon in business.

After a long day on the road, hotel staff suggested the Pub and they were right. I was going to have one if their half pound hamburgers but opted instead for a Huge Cobb salad and my wife had what she described as the best Monte Cristo sandwich that she has ever had! Prices were right also. Only downside were a couple of loud drunks in the bar area.
Good food good service and great price. Great Location and the atmosphere is always fun. I would recommended to anyone.
The food is good, the wings and the hot dog are the best!! I really like to go there and enjoy a good drink with friends and family
We had a large group and called to see if they could take care of us.  Not only did they take care of us, they were quick, efficient, friendly and very accommodating.

We dropped in for lunch while passing through Guymon. We had the Pulled Pork sandwich with Sweet PotaterTots. The pork was nice-moist and tasty. The BBQ sauce on the side was good also. The Sweet PotaterTots were interesting if a bit sweet for my taste (seems some sweetener was added).  Very limited tap beer selection. Service was attentive until it was time for the check. I had to search for a waitress. 
I will return.
This is our second favorite restaurant in town. Not expensive and everyone in our group can find something to eat.
Good service and yummy chicken fried steak sandwich, nobody left hungry.  Service was pretty good even though they were pretty busy
We had a bowl of their home made soup & it was very good nice & hot , like I want soup. I’m sure other things are tasty also

Check or the copper bar....it is impressive.  As a matter of fact, the whole place is impressive. Waitress was excellent. Food was made from scratch, EVEN THE SALSA AND QUESO!  Had the street tacos; lunch special for $5. Definitely a value. So impressed with this restaurant!

Traveling through the Panhandle on a Sunday night. Opted for the pub side. Enjoyed just kicking back and watching locals.... eating, drinking (Sundays in Guymon, OK... no liquor and only 3.2 beer), young men playing pool, families watching football.... etc. Very enjoyable waitress & tender. Much better than average pub food, reasonably priced, big portions, friendly place. I've no qualms about returning next time i'm that way.

Have eaten here 4 times now and have never been disappointed. Very good beer specials and their food ranks near the top in Guymon. Have tried something different every time and liked it all. Usually busy but staff is good. Spacious with seating around bar area and out front in restaurant seating area. Also have a nice room for parties/meetings.

I'm giving them a 3 hoping it was a bad night and that there were a couple of large parties. Upon arrival the was no indication if you were to seat yourself or wait. A gentleman asked us to join him. The salad bar was ok though it took a long time for a salad plate to come.  Hubby had ribeye and shrimp. The shrimp were grilled and good. The ribeye was overdone (for him) and bland. I ordered a monte crispy sandwich but they couldn't make it, don't know why it was on the menu. Ended up with a club sandwich which was okay. Not a great experience.

Drive to Guymond for a "let's go for a drive day"  Stopped off here for dinner.  Very clean inside, cheap drinks and cheap food.  Food was really good!!  The salad bar was fresh and cold.  Husband had the bacon cheeseburger and enjoyed it.  I had the fish and chips.  Probably one of the top best catfish I have ever had.  They hand bread their fish.  So good!!
Spacious. Usually well staffed. Good food. Great variety. Tons of sandwiches to choose from. Great sweet potato fries. Handles large crowds well.
Was able to be seated with big group very quickly. I had beef enchiladas which were some of the better I have had. My wife had the philly which she said was ok. Would go again!
I've met friends here for lunch - good place with quick service, although sometimes getting the initial order in takes some extra time.

Typical sports bar but seemed quite large for the area.  Diverse menu with plenty of choices.  Plenty of beer choices too.  Some pool tables for those that feel the need.  Friendly staff and ample parking.

We visited here on a busy weekend (Bike Rally) and we were seated immediately and our server was helpful and made great suggestions for our dinner. We received our food quickly and we all thought it was delicious.  Great adult beverages suggested by our server too. Moderately priced food and drinks. Will be visiting Pub on the Bricks again!!
Lovely wait staff , Food was outstanding ,,, Lovely Atmosphere close to our hotel. Just what my husband and I craved after a day of traveling 890 miles😌
I get all the birthday cakes at this place just love it
reviewTitle: I get all the birthday cakes at this place just love it

reviewText: Great place, wonderful cakes and pastries.  We've had many special occasion cakes done here- they are the real deal!
reviewTitle: Great place, wonderful cakes and pastries.  We've had many special occasion cakes done here- they are the real deal!

reviewText: Their tea cookies are the best in town!
reviewTitle: Their tea cookies are the best in town!

reviewText: beautiful presentations.  great desserts.
Awesome!
BEST CAKES EVER!!
heavenly desserts!!

Lotta people eating here, so good must be fairly good.  We had excellent service. The BUFFET looked good, with lotsa veggies, desserts, salad bar, & meats that I didn't get an opinion of. We ordered off of the men. The BLT & Grilled cheese were OK. The French fries were packaged fried from frozen. The chili was some WEIRD brown gravy, with so much hot pepper seasoning that I could only take one bite.  Oh yes, the buffet is $12++, & sandwiches $7 with tax.
Food was tasty! This is one of the better petros. Wish they were all like this.friendly staff, clean .

Traveling with a 22 month old, we stopped to use the bathroom for a diaper change and as we were leaving, figured while we were there, we might as well get something to eat at Iron Skillet.  We were told to sit wherever we wanted.  We sat and it took about ten minutes before anyone acknowledged us.  First gal asked for our drink order, and brought us a booster chair.  Second gal came and asked if we were ready to order.  We each ordered the fish and chips basket.  About eight dollars for each basket.  The food sat under the 'light' for awhile before it was brought to our table.  There were three small pieces of fish in each basket.  Not much fish actually but mostly deep fried batter.  The fries were good.  The garlic bread was good.  We ate but we've had much better for a lower price.  Would we recommend?  I don't think so.

Family and I were passing through. Long road trip and it was good to sit down for a meal, but you have to remember that it's still gas station food. Steak tips, Alfredo, and patty melt were all pretty good and very filling. My kids had the Mac and Cheese which was just the simple box stuff. Food was hot and came out fast. It's ok if you really want to sit down, but you could prob do better looking for a Denny's.
reviewTitle: Good food. Skip the salad bar.

reviewText: Easy highway access. Great selection; menu has something for everyone. Chicken Fries Chicken with Mashed Potatoes & Country Gravy was delicious. Salad Bar left a little to be desired; no eggs, no carrots, some burnt croutons. Lettuce was very fresh though. Would stop here again.

We were on a trip to Grand Canyon and saw this off I40. There were lots of cars there so that's always a good sign. I got chicken tender basket and my husband got Beef tips on taters and toast. My husband said it was outstanding. It must have been cause he licked the plate. My tenders were very good too. They have a buffet but I thought it was a little pricey. Will  go back
reviewTitle: really good food for a truck stop

reviewText:
The buffet, on a Saturday night, was "BBQ" plus several other items, salad, and desserts.  The price was $13.99, which seemed high given the location and the fact that BBQ West of the Mississippi is always a dicey proposition.  Being on a budget, I ordered a burger off the menu.  The result was edible, but uninspiring.  

I should have gone with the buffet.  The salad bar was well stocked, considering the location, and the food didn't look bad.

Sweet iced tea, a rarity outside of the South, was a plus.  Friendly service and clean restaurant.
reviewTitle: Below average burger; should have gone with the buffet

reviewText: The Iron Skillet is in the Petro gas complex. Ok menu along with reasonable buffet. Prompt service and friendly staff. This is a general highway pit stop, clean restrooms, tid bits for sale, including nice fudge to take with you in the car.
reviewTitle: Good stop, easy on & off highway

reviewText: If traveling its a place to stop and get a great salad as far as other menu items they were decent.   Great tea great salad easy to get to from freeway

Great bacon, great ham, great tea and they bring you your own pitcher.  Service very good. Our waitress offered to have anything we wanted cooked fresh if the buffet items weren't fresh enough.  We had low expectations coming in but found a very nice stop instead.  Not gourmet but good people.

I have always enjoyed stopping at the Iron Skillet restaurants in Petro truck stops.  It's been couple years since I have been to one and I am sad to report a lower rating.  I always purchase the buffet and look forward to the variety of food.  No more.  Although the salad bar was as fresh as I recall, there were far fewer items on the salad bar and what was missing were the special things I didn't see on others.   The hot food bar no longer had their great fried chicken and a small selection of vegetables.  All the food was well cooked and very good but for $11, it's no bargain and I probably won't come again.  So sad.

Diner piccolo e carino con un ottimo servizio ai tavoli se vuoi fare colazione allamericana questo e un ottimo posto.

Great place ! Great Service and food I loved having Breakfast there 5 days in a row!
The crab cake egg benefits were worth the calories!  Harsh brown was crispy. Spicy crab meat that was very flavorful
reviewTitle: Great all day breakfast options - lunch available too

reviewText: In a little strip mall and it's not very big but it is really quaint. Staff are very friendly r and very good food not too expensive.

This place was buzzing when we visited for a late lunch on a Sunday. They have a lot of interesting fun/creative food options and many creative and delicious drinks. I dropped a star though because they forgot about our order and left us sitting there for about an hour before I asked what happened. Besides that though the staff were friendly and helpful and the food was good. It's clearly a popular spot.

Visited for dinner on 5/15 (during covid) and called in a take-out order. To start, what a cool place and it is too bad we couldn't experience the full atmosphere during our short time. The staff answering was grateful and kind over the phone which was matched by the in-store staff. They were excited to be there and to be serving at their best capacity. There was a fluke with our order which was quickly adjusted before we really know what happened by a gentlemen who I assume was a manager and he was more than generous. We ordered the grilled chicken tacos, a Caesar, Chicken avocado melt and the Croissant bread pudding (fries as both sides). Everything was absolutely delicious and I highly recommend the avocado chicken melt, tasty! Filled our Growler with a Double red IPA for a whopping $14(very tasty). Go here for your take out, you will not be disappointed!!
reviewTitle: Go here for your take out food & brew!

reviewText: We dined here for an early dinner. They were not crowded. The building is very cool and our waitress was good. All the food we got was really good.

We came here a once while in town for GABF and this was a very fun brewery to visit. It was packed when we came, but we were seated promptly and the service was good overall. We had chips and queso, which was tasty and paired really well with their triple IPA, which was very good. We didn't get to try many more of their brews, so we'll have to come back on our next trip to Denver!

I've been to Denver a bunch of times over the last 8 years and I've been to Wynkoop numerous times. They always have a bunch of beers on tap and they are always changing. Nice outdoor seating for people watching (my favorite past time).
reviewTitle: Nice spot for a beer close to Union Station

reviewText: This place was great! The food was hearty and really good and the beers were great too! This place was big so great for larger parties! The Mac and Cheese was awesome!
I had the pleasure of visiting the brewery and sitting outside—what a good group of people and terrific beer.  I will be back on my next trip to Denver!

We stopped here, across from Union Station, after our walking tour.  Huge place, but we were able to sit outside, which is quite nice.  Service was a bit slow, but that may have been due to lunch hour business.   Beer selection of course was wonderful!
Food was OK - like beer places.  No expectations, but happy enough.  Location was great and outside with a good view towards Union Station and people watching on a sunny day!
reviewTitle: Not bad for a Touristy Beer Place

reviewText: A big busy brewery in (or bordering) the Lodo neighbourhood, we came here one night to meet up and get some drinks. We got flights of different beers which were pretty fun and they didn’t throw us out for only getting drinks which was nice. It’s quite loud there and busy but overall it’s a cool place to spend an hour drinking or even getting food. It did look good from afar.
reviewTitle: A big busy pub worth a visit

reviewText: Actually that is just one of several great beers that Wynkoop has. I ordered a flight of their standard five beers, but had to add the Mountain Oyster Stout and the We Be Yammin. Happy hour is a great time to visit, discounts on food are nice. Staff was great. Will definitely return (maybe even tonight).
reviewTitle: Don't forget the 3B's. Bull's Balls Beer.

reviewText: We took the train from the airport to Union Station and stumbled over to the nearby Wyncoop Brewery with our large spinner suitcase. What a relief! We were warmly welcomed seated. Beer was great, food very good. What more could we ask for?  Oh, and days later during our visit to the beer exhibit at the Colorado History Museum we learned that the Wynkoop Brewery was cofounded by former Colorado governor Hickenlooper when he was a young man.
reviewTitle: Good food, great service, convenient location

reviewText: The ambiance is pretty fun-lots of space with with games, different tables and old Denver vibe. The service was fantastic, the drinks were good, but the food was pretty medium. Mine was barely warm. BUT, this is an iconic place and I recommend a visit to the Wynkoop in the heart of Denver.

We visited this place twice on our vacation, which we never do! Both of us could not stop thinking about the Veggie Green Chili! So good we had to come back for more at the end of our trip. Also yourself a favor and get the Brussel Sprouts. So delicious and unique presentation ( no bacon and you won't miss it. ) They offer a half and half so second time around I had the Turkey half sandwich with my Veggie Green Chili order while my husband went for their huge bowl of mac n'cheese to go with his Veggie Green Chili, which he combined the 2 after a while. Another pleasant experience was meeting Justin working behind the bar on both our visits. Justin is the kind of person you want running the bar. He was friendly, engaging, worked constantly, on top of everything, serving and keeping up easily with everyone at the bar but as my husband aptly noticed was that when Justin was talking with you, he was talking with you! He was not distracted looking off or around the room. Not only that, but he remembered us after our visit a week earlier! This kind of service makes for a meaningful experience we will long remember as one of the highlights of our entire trip. Thank you, Justin, for the great Denver hospitality. You made our visit to Denver really fun and enjoyable.
By the way, the brewery is conveniently located by Union Station so rolling your luggage over there to kill time before you need to head to the airport is not a problem. 
This is a place you don't want to miss.
reviewTitle: A Must Stop in to Eat & Drink When in Denver!

reviewText: Located around the corner from Denver’s Union Train Station this trendy brew-pub is well worth a stop for both the craft beers and delicious food. I’m not much of a beer guy but I enjoyed their local pale ale and the Rueben sandwich was superb. We started off with the chips and queso and ended with the Peanut Butter Mousse Pie—and so glad we did; both we excellent bookends to a delicious lunch. Our server was pleasant and attentive. I look forward to visiting Wynkoop Brewing Company on my next visit to Denver
reviewTitle: Great Brew Pub in Downtown Denver!

reviewText: Arrived in Denver lunch time. Heard Denver is known for their beer selection so decided on a brewery. Pick this place because of the reviews and it was a quick walk from our hotel. Very pleased, food, beer flight and atmosphere was perfect. I’m from Texas so walking into a brewery with a billiard upstairs plus bar I’m in heaven. So what I enjoyed Mexican Radio beer with lime, Mac and cheese and free pool. Oh and our server was completely helpful and attentive.

We had a great time and the service was excellent! I was “beered out” so the bartender recommended sangria. Two weeks later I am still raving to my friends! Cozy, delicious, perfection!!! Delicious!!!

This was our first dinner in Denver and I thought it was going to be a good one.  This place was expensive, the beer wasn't good, the service was terrible and the food was equal to applebees, which isn't very good. Parking in the area is also super expensive.

There are many incredible places in North America and the is one not tot to be missed. With a daily menu of Brewed-In-House Beers, Ales, Ciders and Sodas, this downtown location is perfect for any occasion. Bar seating is excellent, dining areas upstairs and down are extremely nice and the noise level of this grand establishment makes conversation not only possible, but enjoyable. The food offerings are inviting with many options for all ranges from Bistro to Vegan. This is a farm-to-table restaurant with 20 beers on tap!
reviewTitle: Wonderful environment, Great beer, Great Food, Great People!

reviewText: Wynkoop has some very creative and enjoyable beers. They have a great selection to choose from so you won't be left picking one of four super hopped beers. The kitchen does a good job too. It is American bar food with some beer inspired dishes. My last visit was Green Chille (vegetarian) that was very delicious and wonderfully spicy. The wings are great. I have my favorite wing spot at home, but when I am in town, this is where I go. The house sauce (Frank's Hot Sauce based) is deliciously peppery.

This brewery and restaurant is located so conveniently across from Denvers downtown Union Station and in an old historic building too.  Our adult group stopped in to quench our thirst and have a mid afternoon snack  before going to dinner  downtown.   Thanks to our server Michelle who was prompt and attentive while serving the guys their Mexi Lager choices, a Cilantro Margarita for myself, and a Grilled Sausage Board.  The board  provided just the right amount of snacks to tide us over.   Always an enjoyable spot  to spend some down time!
reviewTitle: An Absolute Go To for Any Hour Beer and Appetizer Plate

reviewText:
Visited her 3 out of 4 nights during a recent trip.
We were attracted by the range of beers but were so impressed with the service and food too.
Particularly enjoyed the British style cask conditioned ale that was on tap.
reviewTitle: Magnificent choice of beer; great food

reviewText: “Western” wild “Turn-of-the-Last Century” bar with games & sports TV screens. What? Go see! REd Poppers are great (cole slaw better than curly fries), spare ribs are good. Late lunch  not crowded at all. Mad atmosphere hasn’t changed since 1975! Great beer line-up.

This is a 'must see' -place. The exterior is a nice looking house, but the inside is dark, gloomy and strangely decorated. There is a different kind of crap hanging on the roof, which is completely incomprehensible.
Food is ordered straight from the kitchen via hatch and the drinks are picked up at the bar counter.
Hamburgers okay. Fortunately, there was also a vegetable version - two versions!
Beer was good, local and from tap.
Lots of screens that showing different sports.
A fun place to hang out with the gang - now we just wanted to get a glimpse from the place out of curiosity. Not bad!
reviewTitle: A weird, gloomy and maze place to eat and drink

reviewText: Hadn't been in the Dark Horse since the 70s but amazingly enough... not much has changed.  Don't remember the burgers being as good and this time there were lots of families with kids running around.  Glad we chose the Dark Horse for dinner.
reviewTitle: Can't believe this place is still going... strong!!

reviewText:
Granddaughter is a freshman and she chose this place for dinner. Glad she did. Glad non of the stuff over my head fell down.
Very good burgers - good beer and she had a coke.
Interesting approach to service - go to the window - order and pay and they will shout your name.
Prices are good and the burger with great cole slaw was generous size.
Better than Ferg Burger in Queenstown, NZ
reviewTitle: Great evening with people on their way to the game

reviewText: We stopped in as we had good memories of the Dark Horse in the'70's and '80's ... yes a couple of lifetimes ago. The burgers were decent, but overall,the money that they saved by making it totally self-service should have been repurposed to the cleaning crew.

This bar is an iconic fixture in the Republic of Boulder. Students & locals have been going here for decades.  It is typical bar fare, which is actually pretty good.  Lots of beer choices & other adult beverages.  Games galore - a fun place to meet old friends & new.  Fine wine, not so much, but that's not why you go here.  Be part of history & visit.

Not a lot of places endure like this one has!  The burgers are very good, prices are more than fair and it's a fun place to go for happy hour! - Be sure and walk around upstairs and check out all the crazy / humorous kitsch hanging from walls and ceilings!
reviewTitle: Iconic Boulder Bar & Burgers - Been coming since 1989

reviewText: We had some time to kill before flying home from Denver so we made our way through Boulder and found this place in accident.  I’m so glad we did!  This place may have the coolest decor of any place that I’ve ever been to, assuming you’re into it.  The staff were cool because we had a lot of questions , lol.  The wings were great and the pulled pork sandwich with fries was all good as well.  You have to walk around and take it all in.  I’m so glad places like this still exist!

Visited with family for lunch. 

The bar has no windows, and is illuminated by neon signs, TV screens and artificial light. Traditional pub meets student decor. Huge space inside, so great for small and large groups alike. We sat outside where you were permitted to smoked 

Great outdoor views of the foothills of the Rockies and umbrellas to get out of the direct heat. 

Really pleasant server - really chatty and answered all our questions about the menu. Food was tasty - I had wings, which they are allegedly famous for, and they did not disappoint. 

Now. For the bathrooms. The ladies has an arrow pointing to the gents, and the gents has an arrow pointing to the ladies; so naturally I went in the wrong one, which caused many of the locals at the bar to laugh ☺️

Would recommend if you’re in the area
reviewTitle: Good food and drinks - comedy bathroom

reviewText:
As loud, crazy, just short of over-the-top places go, this is a good one.  Prices seemed right. They were calling our food orders pretty quickly and everything was tasty. Everyone in our group proclaimed it had been a great choice for us.

Decent sized portions.  Lots of beer selections and a house red that was cheap and drinkable.

As places like this go, this was a very enjoyable one.
reviewTitle: Excellent for the kind of place it is

reviewText: Such a cool historic bar in the middle of Boulder. The atmosphere is casual/fun. They have a huge collection of random objects stuffed everywhere- walls, celings, etc. Every room is fun to check out everything, and there are lots of rooms. The smell is wonderful--old wood and leather. The food is great, very affordable and quick service. They have added an outdoor patio area which is another great space for entertaining. I have been going there for 30+ years on every trip to Boulder--and it is always a great time!
Great food! Great atmosphere in a college town. Personable staff! Prices were awesome when compared to other places in town.

Stopped here for burgers (under 21 have to be out by 9:45). Order food and pick it up yourself from kitchen window, have to go to bar separately for drinks. Very crowded, but worth it for great burgers at average price for Boulder area. We had Asian wings (bit oversauced) & rocky mountain oysters. Burgers were VERY VERY good (we each got a different type and we were all thrilled with them & would recommend and go back because of the burgers).
reviewTitle: Inconvenient for families but worth it great burgers

reviewText: Love the atmosphere,  the food, and the people. We visit everytime were in town from Texas!!!! Come hungry because you do not want to miss out on their burgers...
We stopped in for some burgers.  They were tastey.   Interesting building with a neat interior.  I’d go back again next time in town.
We have visited the Dark Horse several times and like the laid back feel.  The food is great, always the Blues Burger and hot wings.

Dark Horse bar is a great place serving up great for and libations. This a classic landmark bar in Boulder. Place looks like it was built in the 1800's but is actually built in the mid 1900's. Great service and good food. Cool unique atmosphere!

The World Famous Dark Horse is definitely worth the effort to visit, but can be a bit difficult to find.  It is behind the McDonald's so you may have to meander around back and then find a parking spot.  There most likely will be a full house as it is located very near U of C Boulder.  It is open seating so it may be have to commandeer tables as they become available and pull them together if you have a large group.  Also, there is no waitstaff so you have to order your beer(s) from the bar and then stand in line to place your order with the kitchen.  The menu is mostly pub food (burgers and wings) but my burger was excellent and there is a good selection of their own beer.  I recommend the 90 shilling.  Enjoy!
reviewTitle: Great local seen and beer selection

reviewText: Delicious and reasonably priced food. Staff was friendly and helpful. Lots to choose from and a nice place to meet  up with friends. It does get busy but plenty of room to sit

Staying overnight in Boulder and Dark Horse recommended by hotel. Glad we went. Wasn't crowded on Thursday night, but big place, and layout has multiple themes.  Love the old bar and pub region.  Didn't even know they had karaoke until walking around after finished meal.
No table service, but the order/pick up system works and food ready fast.
Take time to walk around, so many unique/antique/historic things to see.
There for a wedding. Fun surroundings, food excellent. Waite staff did a fabulous job with well over 120 people.  Would be fun to go back and have a chance to sample the beers.
reviewTitle: Great venue for a wedding or any large gathering.

reviewText: Nice place, food was delicious, service a little slow. Good variety of wine. Atmosphere was nice. Decent price for what they offered

I did the Classic flight tasting which included 5 pours (and a 6th gratis to compare the rosés!) and a charcuterie board. Both the wines and cheeses were delightful and Savannah was a great guide. Lovely atmosphere even on a slower evening, and worth a visit if you’re even a casual wine drinker!
reviewTitle: Private tasting is worth the spend

reviewText: CASSIE SULLIVAN, DIRECTOR OF SALES AND EVENTS, AT BIGSBY'S FOLLY WAS OUTSTANDING! I WAS VERY APPREHENSIVE ABOUT PLANNING A BABY SHOWER FROM OUT OF TOWN. CASSIE'S ASSISTANCE IN PLANNING, SET UP DAY THE OF EVENT AND HELP WITH RENTAL PICK UP ISSUE  WAS AMAZING. EVERYONE WHO ATTENDED THE SHOWER LOVED THE VENUE. THE PRODUCTION ROOM WAS PERFECT AND THE FOOD WAS FABULOUS. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND BIGSBY'S FOLLY!

We had a group of 6. nice table, friendly server. They didn't have a wine two of us wanted to try in our flight and they replaced it with a bad one, but upon request to swap out, immediately did so. Cheese board very good. Sparkling wines very nice.

Wine has been good and we have done the blending party which is fun. I writing this because lately the food has gotten worse and the service has been horrible.  We have started skipping the dinning room all together and just doing to go wine.

This is hands down my favorite spot in Denver.  I don't even know where to begin.  The ambiance is incredible.  You literally feel like you've been transported to Napa.  Despite being a wine focused event space, it has an exquisite menu that is constantly changing. 

The staff are super friendly and genuinely happy to be there.  When I first moved here, I didn't know anyone.  They made it feel like my very own "Cheers."  They build a sense of community and know all their regulars.

And finally, OH MY GOD their frosé!  I cannot tell you how amazing it is.  Drop what you're doing and head over there now!
what a fun place for our group of ladies to meet. We had wine and brunch. The staff was very attentive.  The bloody Mary’s were very good.

Most people write reviews about a meal or a single glass of wine. For those looking to host an event this review and this establishment are perfect for you. Bigby's isn't your formal wedding or event venue but if your looking to give your guests a great time, casual and relaxed feelings, all while enjoying great food, the finest wines, amazing service with the friendliest and most helpful, accommodating staff, this is the perfect place for you. I hosted 100 people here and the space was perfect. The food rivaled the finest 4 star restaurant and served home style, to accommodate tables being served quickly and replenished as needed, added to the camaraderie and warm feelings at every table. One of my guests faces serious dietary challenges and couldn't stop commenting on the amazing accommodations she was shown and the quality of the food she was personally served. Cassie, Bigsby's event coordinator and helpful soul extraordinaire, assisted with everything. I am located 1700 miles away and had to blind trust that my event would be serviced properly. Cassie assisted with table rentals, florals, menu, EVERYTHING, and I could never have asked for better! Not a single guest had anything but the highest praise and I could not be happier. Trust Bigsby's you can't get better!

Attended a private event at this bar/bistro.  Really good food, and nice presentation. Patio in back was a nice respite from inside. Crowded, not stuffy away from our event. Nice place, mostly 20-30 year old crowd.
Highly recommend checking this place out. We really enjoyed the flight of reserve red wines. Very cool decor and great music.
reviewTitle: Loved our visit and the wines

reviewText:
This is a great spot to hang out and enjoy the neighborhood and some great wine.  
The cheese plate is a must with the variety of flights.  
Will I Go Back ?  Yes!!  Wine club is good too and offer some good deals and events

We went here last for girls night and this place is so neat! First off, they have a variety of wines and you can get a tasting for $11 which is such a deal compared to California wine tastings. The staff was very friendly too and they went into detail about the menu and although we didn't order any food, all of the food looked delicious. I recommend the Oregon red wine - yum!

They had a bunch of private parties going on there too so if you're looking for a place to host your next event, I would check this place out! The decor is very Colorado. I can't wait to go back!

What a fun restaurant/winery to visit! Great ambiance and atmosphere in this restaurant in the warehouse district in Denver. Staff was super accommodating! Outside seating in the front and back of the restaurant. And you are allowed to bring your dogs to while seated outdoors. Highly recommend and worth a visit!
This is a way fun place for wine tasting and food. The charcuterie board was awesome. There is great seating inside and a beautiful patio. The staff was friendly; the ambiance was exceptional.

We met a friend for drinks before dinner at another restaurant. I had a single glass, and my companions each had flights of the house recommended wines. We liked the space and the staff. But the wine is...not good: sour, tart and harsh were the terms that came to mind for each of us.

We would return for cocktails and to try the food, but cannot recommend the wines at all.

What an awesome place - intimacy created in a large space.  Beautifully appointed-loved the crystal chandeliers attached to rustic wood beams.  Great wine and appetizer selections!  Up and coming neighborhood.  Highly recommend!
We did a wine tasting with a cheese board. The wines were excellent and the service was suburb. The place itself is very cozy.
We met another couple for drinks and appetizers.  Great wine selection.  Great food.  Staff was friendly!  Up and coming trendy neighbourhood!
reviewTitle: Great place to spend an evening!

reviewText: We had drinks and appetizers outside on the patio....all was great!  Good service and food.  Really neat up and coming neighbourhood!
Excellent food and wonderful service.  One great salad bar.  Food made fresh to order.  Prices are great.
Great atmosphere and great people. Go here all the time with family and for meetings. Good food and good prices.
Bland, IQF, Unconcerned staff.  Wanting a hamburger.  You know, ground beef patty on a couple of pieces of bread.?  McDonalds is cheaper AND better.

Stayed in Guymon for a night on a recent road trip, so I needed a place to grab a bite to eat before settling in for the night. 

I found the Pub on the Bricks in downtown Guymon and was pleasantly surprised. I sat at the bar as I was travelling solo; however, there is a more family friendly restaurant portion of this establishment as well. I started with a beer, the draft selection left much to be desired, but it was happy hour, so I got a 16oz. Blue Moon for $1. No complaints there. To eat I enjoyed steak fingers with tots and okra. Great pub food. The service was very good as well, and ample TVs for watching your favorite sports.

Stopped for lunch passing through Guymon, OK. . They make homemade potato chips and they are the best.  The green chili cheese burger was very tasty.  Its a popular spot with the locals and LEO's.  Also a full service bar along with the restaurant.  Fifth Street amd Main.

Traveled through Guymon and ate at this pub. The pub was downtown and split between a dining room and a nice bar area.We had the fried pickles-GREAT. I had a Ruben and wife had a pulled pork sandwich and both were very good. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive.
Great place.   Awesome music!  Love the atmosphere and the staff.  Fajitas are always great! Jesse is a great bartender!  My 2 year old loves watching the activity!

The food is fantastic.  The ambiance is great.  The $5 lunch special  can't be beat. It is centrally located to my job, so I walk there several times a week. The staff is outstanding.  The owners are hard working and are almost always there working.  Love the menu.  This place is overall the best place to eat in Guymon.

Found this place on "Trip" and went to check it out. 

As mentioned by others you can over look it thinking it is something else. Never the less, I found it.

I chose the back part with the bar. Worked perfect as I wanted to check out the Olympics on TV. 

The bartender was really helpful with my menu selection. I went with the green chili cheeseburger. It comes with any side and I chose tater tots. It was good. The atmosphere was the real star. I had a great time with the locals at the bar. 

I will be back and will be more adventurous now that I can trust the food.

Had planned to eat at The Galleon as it was #1 recommendation and, when I called, they said they were open until 10pm and the bar later. But, when we arrived, they had closed early and suggested "the pub" around the corner. Finally figured out where it was and that it was The Bricks. Chose to eat out front rather than back bar area. We shared a decent mushroom Swiss burger w onion rings. I also went to salad bar which, for being late in the day, was still fresh and supplied nicely. Our bill, with two alcoholic beverages and tip, came to just under $25.
On a road trip recently we stayed in Guymon both coming and going. We ate there both times. Food was served hot and fast. The servers were both personable and very good.

I enjoy the pub when I want a pub experience.  The menu is good and the food is very consistent and good. Service is excellent and there is comfortable room, we're not all squashed together.  It is a pub, so there are TVs and music and it's a little loud, as you would expect a pub to be.  The restaurant up front is much more quiet.

Was traveling solo through Guymon and wanted some dinner. Was surprised how big the place is -- seemingly bigger on the inside, TARDIS-like. Ordered the catfish, which came with a trip to the small but nicely stocked salad bar and two additional sides. Food was better than average bar food, prices were more than reasonable for the portion size, and staff was friendly if a little rushed, since it was March Madness and Wing Night so there was a large crowd where I was in the pub.
reviewTitle: Look for the sign that says ALLEN'S

reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful meal Ina great atmosphere. We sat on the pub side and had porkchops and a Ruben sandwich. It was good and lots of it. LOVE homemade chips!!!

Went to this little restaurant three times during the Easter break while visiting this town.  Service was excellent, the salad bar was refreshingly fresh and looked so healthy, the entrees were all so delicious and served in a pleasing manner.

We eat lunch at the bricks a few times a month, and I have to say we really enjoy the food, servers, and the atmosphere. My favorite dish is the Chicken fajitas with beans and rice, and I Love the rice! We appreciate Michael & Krystal and all the staff for their hard work and GOOD FOOD.

To be fair the place was comfortable, the servers friendly and all the people there seemed to be enjoying their time there.  The food that we had was very mediocre, not awful, but not something you would want to come back for.  My husband had a rib plate KC style and they didn't seem home made, frozen and served like Applebee's.His sweet potatoe fries he said were good, the Mexican rice awful.  I ordered catfish.  Only 2 pieces for a half serving.  Those two pieces looked like potatoe wedges and didn't really taste like catfish.  The fries were limp and greasy and the salad bar was below par. The place was clean and as I said everyone was friendly. We will be in Guymon every few months for the next year and I doubt we will stop back in this restaurant again.
reviewTitle: Not Up to The Reviews I Read

reviewText: We had a long day, starting in Holbrook and losing teo hours to day light savings time. Searching for a place tobeat in Guymon was frustrating.  Very few recent reviews and even fewer good reviews.  We settled on the bricks and we very pleasently rewarded.  We were kind of reluctant to hit a pub but the food was really quite good and the service was quietly efficient.  Go there, you will be glad you did!!

Great general menu, fabulous $5 lunch specials. Fast service from friendly servers.  Love the ambiance in the pub portion.  There is a pub area and a general dining area, so you chose where you would like to eat.  There is also a meeting room.

3 things that matter were present :  cleanliness, great service and awesome food. Additional plus was you could tell food was from scratch. Having moved to this area from KY I have had difficulty with that. No more!!!!  I will be a regular.

authorName: The Places Where We Go Podcast
reviewText: Stopped here for beers and dinner prior to a hockey game at Pepsi Center.  Decent beer selection - our table going for ESB, an Ommegang Belgian, and a saison.  These were paired with their fish and chips.  Fish was a bit on the crunchier well browned side - I probably prefer my fish in this style somewhat more lightly golden fried. Service was extremely attentive and friendly.  Enjoyable.
This old 2 story building has lots of great beer as well as lots of character.  The upstairs has several pool tables.   A nice causal place.

Here for another private party with about 400 people or so.  We had one of the upstairs rooms, this place is huge.    Food was just so so, drinks and service excellent.   I would not be seaking out this place, but it was good for a party this size

Stopped by after walking the downtown area with family. We pulled up seats outside for great views, people, and the beautiful weather.
Everyone was happy about their choice.

My wife and I were out clubbing and decided to stop by for appetizer and a drink. We were very happy with the service we received as well as the food and drink. We hope to come back soon for a full meal. However, my bathroom experience was interesting after being tapped on the shoulder by one of the ghostly residents...great time great stories
We were attended to very well and seated quickly. Very attentive waitress. Very happy with the food. Would love to go back.
We stopped by for lunch and a few drinks.  My son got a few local brews and I had wine.  We got a plate of nachos to share and they were some of the best I've ever had.
Four of us had the sampler which was outstanding. Great selection of beer and the staff was very helpful explaining all the options. Had the rocky mt oyster beer which was unusual but tasty.
reviewTitle: Great beer, outstanding service and good food

reviewText: This renovated old Denver building has become a trendy place to meet friends and have snacks.  It was a fun atmosphere.

Stopped for a quick, small bite on our way to the game. Had the pretzels and beer cheese. Delicious! Hubby enjoyed his beer and I enjoyed my tequila mojito. Enjoyable start to a fun evening! Would recommend.

Was touring breweries and came here for good food and beer. Thought the outdoor seating overlooking union station was lovely. The beer was average and the food was decent but overpriced. I enjoyed the bbq chicken salad, but not for 14$. Friendly wait staff but this was nothing special for out of towners.

We came in just to try the beer and were lucky enough to have Big Mike as a server. Friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable.

Loved the beer we tried - and they have a huge variety to pick from.

Sitting outside was lovely!
We had hot wings and short rib grill cheese; was really good. Ample portions and priced reasonably. My husband got the beer sampler and was a very happy man :)

We landed on Thursday and weren’t sure where to go for my birthday dinner. 4 of us tried Wyncoop, and I will say I was a little skeptical at first. David was our server and I will say he completely changed the experience for the better. The food was excellent but the service, and the historical stories about the Wyncoop were awesome! Thanks again, David!

Popped in for a quick drink before going on for a meal.  Large selections of beers, many made on the premises.  Member of staff very good in letting novice craft beer people have a taste.  I tried the wheat beer with Beet through, not to my taste so ended up having a cider.  We were very pleasantly surprised when we tried to pay that the first drink was free on the house.  This might be their normal practice, but it was obvious we were tourists so probably not going to be repeat customers.  Lovely treat. Atmosphere in bar very friendly, food looked good but didn't try anything

We went here at the end of our vacation. We tried two different beers and had a beef and bison burgers. The service was very nice and good advice about the beers given. 
The burgers were great however we did not taste any difference between the beef or bison, we suggest to take the beef and save  4 USD.
The beers were very nice and if we return to Denver we for sure will go back.
Had the salmon sandwich yesterday and it was perfectly cooked. I like the accompanying ingredients and the focaccia bread.

On our first night in Denver we had to check out the city's first Brewpub so we headed to Wynkoop which was only around the corner from our Airbnb to start our beer exploration of the city.
We were peckish but not starving so chose the Brewhouse Sampler to pick at. Unfortunately both the sliders and the pretzel knots were dry and not particularly flavoursome. 
The couple next to us had to send their first order of wings back as they were the wrong ones and then barely touched the second portion claiming they were cold and didn't taste like buffalo wings at all. Maybe the kitchen was just having a bad day.
The beer is better although I wasn't a massive fan of any of my beers on my beer flight on the first night we visited apart from the stout. 
When we returned for the brewery tour a couple of days later we had a much more positive beer experience. The tour was fun and informative, the beer plentiful and much better than we were expecting following the first night. 
Go for the beer, skip the food.
reviewTitle: Go for the beer not the food

reviewText:
Visited Wynkoop twice while in Denver. Once to try the beer and a second for dinner. Both times were very good! 

I’ll start with dinner. I had the Bison Burger. Very tasty! I’ve had bison in the past, and this one didn’t disappoint. I ordered it medium-well, and it was not dry. Very good flavor. My girlfriend tried the Nashville Hot Chicken. We’re from Nashville, so not sure how this one would stand up. It was pretty good, but not like in Nashville. A little too much heat & not enough flavor. Still, she enjoyed it. 

Now for the real reason to try Wynkoop - the beer. I tried two different beers my first day there. First was the Move Your Car Porter. I’m a big fan of porters and stouts, and this lands on my top 10 list for porters. Very smooth and flavorful. Rich, but not too heavy. I really enjoyed this beer. Next I got adventurous and tried the Rocky Mountain Oyster Stout. Believe it or not, this beer has bull testicles in the recipe - no joke. I asked the bartender about it and he told me it was great. He said it has a very smoky flavor. So I tried a 5-oz. sample. Wow, what a pleasant surprise! He was right - smoky, rich flavors. I compared it to Yazoo Sue. I liked it so much, I ordered a full-sized glass with dinner the next day. 

Definitely try the beers, and give the food a shot too. You won’t be disappointed.

Nice relaxed place with home brewed beer – make sure you go down to the basement and look at the beer tanks. We had a couple of pints chicken wings and a pulled pork sandwich. Very down to earth but serious about their beer.
It was very good .My husband had the pork chops he said they were very tender good flavor .I had the sirloin it had good flavor but could have been a little more tender . Good service .
I had trouble finding a good place to eat in Guymon but this was a pleasant surprise, great food and service!

My husband and I stopped here for lunch on Sunday afternoon.  We ordered sandwiches off the menu-  I had a hamburger and  my husband had the Ruben.  Both were very good as were the sides- homemade potato chips and sweet potato fries  We would definitely stop again.  The building itself is impressive- apparently built for an implement dealer years ago so it has an open span design.

After a long morning of driving across western Kansas, one of the loneliest drives to be had anywhere, Guymon looked and felt like a big city. It was lunchtime, and I pulled in here and had a good experience. The Bricks looks and feels like a college-town or even big city spot, and I bet it's pretty popular after dark. I certainly wasn't expecting this in Guymon. The service was good, my burger came out promptly, and it was good. Fortified, I felt ready to drive several more hours through some pretty lonely country.
reviewTitle: Great oasis on a long drive across the plains.

reviewText: We have eaten here many times and have always been good food no matter what you order!! Service some times can be a little slow..

Given the limited choices available on a Sunday evening, we went here.  Sat in the bar area as the main dining room was closing.  Salad bar was awesome--haven't seen one that good in quite some time.  Had a Blue Moon on tap and fried catfish.  The food was good, portions were huge, service was decent, and prices are cheaper than what I expected.  Great stop.
reviewTitle: Where to Go on a Sunday Night?

reviewText: For lunch, we decided to try this place as it was close to the meeting location. The building is a re-purposed oil well motor building with high ceilings. It has a great feel to it. The food was excellent as was the service. There are multiple televisions broadcasting sports plus pool tables.
There was no ID problem. Wasn't even asked for one, was just told that we could not be served. Obviously, We  would have been fine with showing our valid United States issued IDs.

The fact that my wife made a bad review, got us on the no service list. This restaurant is a joke. The no service list might sound bad, but once you've seen the service, it's basically the same thing. Reviews should make you want to improve, but they just hide them and bar people that wrote them. There are very good waitresses, but they are over shadowed by the incompetent ones.
food was excellent and reasonably priced.  the service was a bit slow but we were in no hurry.  seems like a place the locals frequent a lot.  we will go there again when in Guymon.
This is the best place to eat. The service is great, the food is great and you always get plenty to eat. Best Wings in town.

Service here is great, food is excellent, but the pub distinction is questionable. To me a pub is a place with great beers on tap. Bricks has a few 3.2 domestics and that is about it. Bottle selection is also slim. Overall though if you are not a beer snob like myself and can do 3.2 bub/miller/coors light, it is likely OK.

My husband and I stopped at the Pub on the Bricks while on a road trip.  We were pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere and the quality of the food.  We had a sweet bartender that chatted with us. The grilled catfish was delightful.   Great prices.  The free salad bar is a definite plus although we don't usually eat that much food.  Come hungry and don't be afraid to sit at the bar for dinner!
reviewTitle: Good food, good service, good prices

reviewText: We saw the Pub on the Bricks in the Oklahoma Magazine and heading west to New Mexico we made this our dinner stop.  Great food, large menu and the prices were very reasonable.  If ever back in the panhandle of OK; this would by a stop once again.
A great casual spot in Downtown Guymon.  I enjoyed lunch, and look forward to going back for dinner or nighttime fun.

I found this place on trip advisor. I checked the address and look for sign saying Pub on the Bricks but the sign on the building said "Allens." That's the name of the old retail store that used to occupy this building and it was confusing to me until I parked the car and took a closer look.

Once I was inside I realized that this was half restaurant and half bar/pool hall. It was pretty busy at 9 o'clock on a Sunday night. There were plenty of TVs to watch football. I ate at the bar, had a burger and some chips and salsa which were very good. The bartenders took care of me quickly. 

If I lived in Guymon, Oklahoma I'd come here almost every day. Since I pass through Guymon once a year, I'll be sure to stop here each time I come in the future.

I had planned to eat here when I was in Guymon because of the good reviews.  However, I couldn't find the place even with GPS.  It said I was there, but I didn't see any signs to indicate where it was and didn't see enough cars around to give me a clue.  Sorry I missed the opportunity to try your food.

We ate in the front part of the restaurant which is more family friendly, but we wished we would have gone to the bar area. It's large with plenty of tv's, pool tables, etc. and the atmosphere seemed more like something we would have enjoyed. But the front part was fine. The food was good "bar" food. Actually, we felt it was a little above average for a bar-like atmosphere. It was clean and the waitstaff took care of our needs.
I have been in Guymon many times and I most often choose "The Bricks" as my eating place. They know how to treat and serve you right at "The Bricks"!
If you're in Guymon and want a place to relax or watch the game this is a really nice place. I love the ceilings. The service is quick and friendly.
reviewTitle: Really nice place for a small town.

reviewText: An employee of the hotel we were staying at recommended this as a lunch restaurant.   The food was great!! Please be aware that this is a bar that happens to serve food and not a restaurant that happens to have a bar.  Seat yourself,  find the kitchen and order and then head to bat for drinks.   You have to listen for your name over blurry speaker to get your food and the traffic can be busy inside.   The food is worth it though.

I love this place, with all the funky antiques, books, lights, vintage movie bills, signs, etc....but we come here for the burgers.  It is my second favorite place for a burger in the area, the best being Murphy's South's Blue Cheese burger.  

The Dark Horse burgers are are juicy, flavorful, fresh, with various combinations of cheeses, bacon, toppings.  The local, up-and-coming chains around here claim great burgers...but honestly they over-sell and way under-deliver.  The meat is cheap and too salty.  It is all gimmick and hype.  Go for real, a bit of funky, and the staff is always friendly.  Have a burger, get a local Avery/Left Hand stout, porter or ale...and enjoy.  Bottled root beer for the kids.  

BTW, you order food at the kitchen window and drinks at the bar.  No wait service other than clean-up.
Awesome atmosphere, cool looking bar, good burger.  Looks like it would be a fun place for drinks in the evening.

Unique decor with tasty food. Lots to look at while enjoying your food and beverages. Don't know if it was just the day of the week but no waitresses or waiters. Sign on table let you know. Had to order food at a window then order drinks at the bar. Not a problem, though, just added to the atmosphere. They called out your name when your food was ready. Fun and unforgettable experience.

Lindo bar con decoracion tipica de bares universitarios
Buenos platos de comida rapida. Bien ambientado. Terraza para fumadores.

I liked the side salad, the dressing, and the fixings on the burger. I'm no fond of high-fat burgers and refined white bread, so I guess I won't be back anytime soon. The beers were great, and the atmosphere is fun.

We stopped here on a Monday afternoon. The place is huge. We were seated on the far side by the pool tables. The service was excellent. They had quite a few local beers on tap and the burgers were great.

Great place with cool atmosphere!  Good service and good food!  Last time I was here was 20 years ago and frankly do not think it has changed a bit.  Still have steel tip dart boards which is a rarity these days.  Took my boys here and told them it will probably be just the same in 10 years.

I found this place via Yelp, when I was looking for a place for dinner in Boulder, that served Rocky Mountain oysters. The place is pretty huge. My boyfriend and I arrived on a Sunday night at around 7 and it wasn’t too busy. It’s self service - you order at the counter, grab a table, and they’ll announce your name over the PA system once your order is ready.

We ordered wings, which were good, and the Rocky Mountain oysters, which I didn’t really like. It didn’t really taste like anything; just fried bits of something weirdly textured/crunchy. I’m still glad I tried it though, because now I’ll never have to order it again. Didn’t seem like anybody else was ordering this though. For my entree, I had the chipotle chicken sammie (charbroiled chicken breast , chipotle pepper, mayo, bacon, pepper - jack cheese, lettuce, onion, tomato, pickle on a toasted bun). It wasn’t anything special: just a chicken sammie that was pretty greasy. I did enjoy the curly fries though.

Overall, I think we ordered too much fried food. The sandwiches are already pretty greasy so I feel like you should order something non-fried to balance it out. I recommend the cole slaw!

The Dark Horse was recommended to us by the front desk staff of the Best Western Plus Boulder Inn upon check in back in November and we received the same recommendation when we stayed again in late May.  Close enough to walk but plenty of parking on a Tuesday night after Spring graduation.  (Much tougher to find parking on a Saturday in late November.)  Yes, it is a college bar, can be crowded and loud but their fresh, cooked to order burgers with fries are well worth the $ and just happened to be Tuesday night special.  Paid less than $7 each.  They accommodated our carryout request without any issues.  Did not disappoint.  Yum!

To the people rating this place badly because of self-service, no gluten-free buns, and a loud atmosphere, it's a BAR. So tired of the people who leave 600 trip advisory reviews (600?!) who are annoyed because they have to stand up to go order the food they shove down their gullet. This place first of all has amazing burgers and wings,  the cheapest beer/liquor in boulder, and an awesome atmosphere. Bar tenders are fast and accurate and the food comes out in 15 minutes max. This place has been around since my grandfather went to school at CU and I love how they haven't changed much. If you don't like this place then you are missing the point, you old fake celiac who ruined the housing market and planet.

-Sincerely college students (b/c its a bar, did I say that?)

Our family members that we were visiting called this place a hole-in-the-wall dive, but in reality it was very interesting and an enjoyable experience.  Being as we were from out of state we wanted to taste the local fare and local beers.  Check and check!  We had some excellent appetizers to include the Rocky Mountain Oysters which were sliced in thin slices and lightly seasoned and breaded.  They were very good and comparable to our pork tenderloins from IN, even though we knew what they really were.  We had a great tour of the different rooms and all of the interesting collection, which you should not miss.  It was a weeknight, so I think it may have been less busy, but it was still quite enjoyable.  Even with tvs on they were not the focus or the noise in the background, so it wasn't a sports bar atmosphere. (thank you)  I recommend you give this place a try.
The food was excellent here, but make sure you take a look around the building.  So many cool and unique decorations.  Definitely worth the stop.
Perfect place to visit for lunch. Super friendly bartenders and excellent burgers. Also tried the fish and chips. Local beers on tap. Highly recommend!

Just stopped in to watch some nfl football, had aome beers and appetizers. If applebys hired a drunk biker gang to decorate, this would be the result.  And I mean that as a high compliment.  Fun crowd,  decent food and drink. Totally worth a visit.

Dark closed in venue that smells badly of moldy hvac, beer breath and bodies. Burger was small and raw, fries were greasy. Some tables waited 45 minutes for food. Found cigarette butts in the outdoor table cracks.

I stayed in Boulder 3 days. Being alone the night before flight back home, I checked Dark Horse bar to enjoy some company and it worked. The bartenders were sociable and fun guys. I ordered a burger from kitchen and had it at the bar with a couple of local beers. The burger was delicious.

A perfect complement to the White Widow we had in the parking lot this afternoon at 4:20
Or your drinks at the bar put them on the first table you find walk over to the kitchen window order some killer food go back to your table they will shout your name in a very strange way

This is a one of a kind restaurant and bar that is worth checking out.  The food is good bar-food at a reasonable price.  This is self service, so pick a table, then order your food at the kitchen window, beer at the bar.  They will call your name when your food is ready.  The decor is hard to describe.  It is like an antique store exploded inside, leading to a fun and interesting visit.  If you like a unique, college atmosphere, this is worth checking out.
