reviewTitle: A good classic college town hole in the wall bar

reviewText: Dark Horse has a great atmosphere.  Total college town hangout.  Food is pretty good.  Good burgers.  Lots of seating area. Families are welcome before 9pm afterwards it's 21 and over.
reviewTitle: Great College Tavern Food and Bar

reviewText: I had no idea when I entered the Wynkoop Brewing Company that there was great story behind it. The place is owned by four people who started it back in the 80's before the area was known and LoDo, before Coors Field was built and certainly before the restaurant boom in Denver.  And, one of the owners is John Hickenlooper, who until last week was running for President! The old building is awesome, the food is pretty typical pub food with lots of comfort food.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which comes with coleslaw and pickles, on a brioche bun.  It was good and worth the price, but not the best bbq I've had.  They have beer pairings and tastings which is nice. The beers were excellent, we each ordered a variety and tasted among ourselves.  The staff is very friendly.  It was just nice to be in a place that has lasted over the years and is in  what is now a trendy and convenient area.  I recommend stopping by , even for just a beer. Try the pretzel bites, just enough for a late afternoon snack  I wish these guys continued success. p.s. apparently Pres. Obama stopped by  a few years ago and played pool and had a beer.  He liked it so much that he requested that particular brew always be available.  I can't remember the name, but you can ask about it. The joke is that it is always available...for Pres. Obama.
Maten var riktigt god och utbudet av öl var väldigt bra. Många lokala öler och öler som de brygger själva. Enkelt att boka bord online. Väldigt trevlig personal.
I tried the flatiron steak and they made it perfectly to my liking.  The potatoes tasted amazing and the asparagus was perfect. Great business meal.

Nice (and huge) sportsbar in LoDo.
Beers brewed on site and really good,large choice.
Good food too.

We stopped by after walking around the neighborhood. We were disappointed that Patty’s Chili Beer was sold out so we tried the Pale Ale Mile High. Not disappointed, hoppy, malty, well balanced.
Our other family members got a margarita and a lemonade vodka. Sat outside under the cover as it had started to rain.

We visited the Wynoop Brewing company on our first visit to Denver. We stumpled upon the place looking for somewhere to eat and drink after a long flight from London and was not dissapointed.  Friendly Staff greated us and took care of us into the evening - recommending beers and serving us great food.  I would definetley return and that we did on our next trip to Denver.   Great location too in the centre of Denver near the Station.

Recommended by touring guide, who said Wynkoop had a great beer selection. She was right and the food was tasty. We went on a Tuesday night at 6:30 pm with 14 adults and 4 kids and the place was busy. Waitress did a pretty good job handling multiple tables and our large group. They have a kids menu so it's family oriented. Everyone seemed to have a good time and were happy with their meal. It's loud when the restaurant is full so if you want to have a conversation, it may be difficult.
reviewTitle: Good Place for Pub Food and Beer

reviewText: It’s a brewery so gluten free options aren’t plentiful. Food was good too. Loved the bacon wrapped shrimp.

you will totally love this place. I was the only non-drinker in my party of 38 so I personally did not enjoy the evening; however, that does not take away from the appeal of the “pool hall saloon”atmosphere that was well done. The food was very good and the 30 minute beer brewing tour was interesting.
reviewTitle: If you are a beer drinker...

reviewText: We had an awesome time having dinner here, great beers and wonderful food, including many vegetarian and vegan options.  Service was friendly and helpful.  Great time.

Stopped by for a beer and stayed for three. Great atmosphere and quiet enough to actually carry on a conversation.  Building is said to be haunted but did experience the young girl or cat during our stay.  History of the building is interesting with some articles in the lower level.  A must stop in Denver.

Stopped by here to try the beers and just relax while in the area.  I tried the Cowtown  Milk Stout which was delicious.  Loved the fact that they had quite a few choices and weren't too heavy on the IPAs.  Sat on the patio and people watched while enjoying our beers.  Very knowledgeable and friendly wait staff.
This place is crazy busy on game days. Great beer, great food but be prepared to wait when it’s overrun with Rockies fans.

We had a very enjoyable lunch here, sampling a few of the Wynkoop beers.  We also had the Brewhouse sampler to eat, which was plentiful and tasty, with good variety.  It was nice to sit outside in the sunshine on the terrace, which was a prime spot for people watching.  Service was friendly and prices were very reasonable.

We stopped for a few beers and a snack. A decent choice. My sour beet juice beer was unique. I couldn’t drink it very fast, but it was good. I snacked on queso and chips. They were good, pretty spicy. My husband’s first beer was to sour for him, but really enjoyed the second lager style. A pretty popular place with not many seats remaining at the bar on an early Saturday afternoon!
Had a drink here and did not know which beer to start with. Great choice and taste. Ended up eating here as well. If you want burgers etc then this is the place to go.
The bar was very busy and quite noisy but they found us a table at the back. Good menu of normal pub food with decent portions.

While doing the brewery tour this place was our last stop, so we decided have lunch there. Hamburgers were tasty, I loved the sweet potato fries. Friendly staff, good service, great atmosphere, reasonable prices.

Came here with my mom and uncle for a brewery tour. We weren't expecting much, but had a really great time! Our tourguide brought us some beers to taste while explaining a lot about the process of brewing, but also the history of Wynkoop and downtown Denver. Then we got a tour: it is not a big brewery, but very interesting and they have some interesting things to see. Our tourguide was great and we had lots of fun. Would definitely come here if you are thinking about doing a brewery tour in Denver!
Excellent burger and tasty beers a short distance from Coors Field.  Plenty of food for the money and good atmosphere, will definitely go back!
reviewTitle: Stop here on your way to the game!

reviewText: This place is old, dirty and needs serious updating. A friend was visiting from out of town and selected this place (not sure why) but it was dirty, sticky floors, old, and the decor is confusing. Looks like everything was pulled from a junk yard and hung on the walls and ceilings (no joke). We ordered food, which took a while, and when I got my burger and fries, they were cold! And it took 20 minutes to get a beer standing in line at the bar. They don't have waitresses. You go up to the window to order your food, and you wait forever in line at the bar, and there's no organization. So disappointing. Lastly, the women's restroom, labeled on the door, is the men's room and vice versa. They think they're clever, but it's annoying. Baffled as to how this place is still in business. Don't plan on a visit again.

This is by far one of the most interesting and entertaining places I have seen in Colorado or pretty much anywhere else for that matter.  The food is very good and fairly priced, and the self-service vibe is perfect.  The drinks are similarly priced fairly and the bartenders are attentive and polite.  You will love the decor, and there will be something new to look at every time you visit.  I was there for two nights on this past visit, and ate there both nights.
This is a good college town dive. Lots of beer options. The food was actually quite good. The noise level was high. Great patio in back.

We were a little surprised by the level of scrutiny of our identification at the entrance (NOTE for overseas visitors: passports are the preferred ID).  As a group of senior middle aged folk from the UK, we haven't had that challenge since we were 18 (or 16!).  We loved the tasty Mexican beanie burgers and curly fries.  The local microbrewery beer was excellent.  The staff were very friendly and that atmosphere was excellent, with live music (Saturday night), and lots of curious pub knick-knacks adorning the walls, ceilings, and just about everywhere.  A very enjoyable experience
reviewTitle: Eclectic pub with decent vegetarian food

reviewText: Good food, unique style, especially when ordering food with quality beers not necessarily found everywhere.  Fun spot for a bike stop motored or not😊
地元の人が良く訪れるお店でした。ハンバーガーは、とても美味しかったです。旅の思い出にお訪れてみてください。
reviewTitle: アメリカンな庶民派レストラン

reviewText: Attending graduation my son took us here for lunch.   Great hole in the wall.  Food is very simple/basic bar food with burgers/sandwiches.    A fun place to take in the college atmosphere.
reviewTitle: Hole in the wall college hang out

reviewText: I'm really giving it 3.5 stars. The atmosphere is a lot fun with all sorts of things hanging from the ceiling in an almost carnival "fun house" type of setting. The food is darn good for tavern food and there's a great beer selection, as in most good places these days. Screens everywhere for sports and make sure you choose the right door when using the rest rooms.

This is a fun little bar.  Not really my place but the food was excellent.  They did not have food service so you had to order your food at a window and get drinks from the bar.  The inconvenience was worth it.  Everyone raved to us about this place and it served great bar food.  I had the BBQ ribs and I was satisfied and happy.  A friendly place where everybody seems to know everyones name.  Don't have expectations of being served and you will have a fantastic experience.  Also be aware of the bathrooms.  The door has a big finger pointing to the other restroom with men or women on it.  It's a joke.  My friend ended up in the men's bathroom confused about the troughs.

Within walking distance to our hotel. What a cool "typical college" spot: great decor...a mix of everything on the walls and ceiling. 
The burgers were really good...made better by the fun atmosphere. (Totally makes me wish that I had a place like that where I went to college.)
This place is the real deal.  Nestalgia, fun and a gear place to hang.  Lots of room and rooms to hang out.  Its the wild west all over again.
Awsome place great atmosphere family friendly video games for the kids happy hour 4 to 6 good beer selection
Great bar with typical "bar food".  Prices are reasonable and atmosphere is relaxed.  Great place to unwind with some good food and drink.
reviewTitle: Great Place for a Bite and a Drink

reviewText: We bring the kids here when out of town guests are around on a weekend afternoon. Burgers and fries are great. Kids love the games, we love the beer and atmosphere. In our experience, adults here don't really mess with kids at all, in case you're reluctant to bring your kids into what is essentially a drinking establishment (though I would not bring kids on a weekend evening).
reviewTitle: A Boulder institution, great for out-of-town visitors

reviewText: Great place to have a low key grilled no frills burger and beer.  Ordering is done at the bar and kitchen but don't forget to listen for your name when your order is up.  Nice low lighting, quite sports tv, and my fav air hockey!

Great specials, good bar food, fun games!   
Super great place to watch sports, too.
Would totally give them 5 stars if their pool tables/dart boards were replaced...janky, but still fun!
great local bar and walking distance to the hotel.  Sports bar with great hamburger which is what the front desk told me.  Quirky but with lots of televisions to watch sports on

We really enjoyed the burgers here, but the one disappointment is that they have NO GLUTEN FREE buns. In today's day and age, in a town like Boulder, there is really no excuse for this. They are now cheap to keep on hand, with freezing not even being required by many of the vendors and the air packed last weeks.  I think they need to get with the times and get them in stock to make EVERYONE in the party have good choices and enjoy their wonderful burgers.
reviewTitle: Great quality burgers and fries, not great for gluten free

reviewText: Great food, but a confusing and chaotic chore to get it. no table service, you must go to the order / pick up window located in a crowded hallway. The food was quite good and very reasonable priced, but almost not worth the effort. Adult beverages are available from two separate bars but not at the food window. Quite noisy as it's a popular destination for the college crowd. Lots of interesting stuff to look at throughout.. much like the old Minder Binders in Tempe, Az. Not recommended for young ones though they are allowed in the dining area.
reviewTitle: Interesting place to spend an adult evening.

reviewText: Wings were changed to much larger cheaper chicken wings. Boulder Born and raise blocks from here..grew up in this place its sad to see this

I stopped in on a Saturday, both the bar and food were self-serve, you have to place your order, no wait staff.

The burger took a long time to come out, I ordered a well done, and this was just raw.
No excuse for that, the kitchen was not that busy.

The whole restaurant is a historical site with many contractions on the walls and celling.

I have been there a few times and have always enjoyed it, but this time was just a little below average.
reviewTitle: Used to be a good place

reviewText: We just happened upon this restaurant in our recent travel.  We had a great burger there!  However pay great attention if you have to make a stop in the restrooms!  It can be tricky as I learned when coming out of the stall and there was a gentleman leaving from washing his hands.  I questioned myself on being in the right place!  Was a nice place and great food.

Love this place.  Can't even begin to cover all the strange things on the wall.  A Rube Goldburg machine behind the bar.  Follow the story written on the walls.  Food is decent.  Happy hour goes until 8 during the week.  Careful when you use the restroom.  Art on the wall runs from old carnival pieces, wagons, and porn from the 70's.
reviewTitle: Unique dive bar with great food

reviewText: Really liked the atmosphere and the burger was very good as well.  I'd recommend this to anyone in the area.

We stayed in Boulder for couple of days and got the place recommended by some locals - it's the place to get peanut butter burger with bacon. Well, it's a bombn of fat and flavour - with fries as a side you can' t bearly move afterwards.

This place seems like more of a place to go drinking or for a one time visit to check out the kitschy decor. The food wasn't bad but rather average. One of these places where you go retrieve your own food. Probably a fun place to go for drinks, but my guess is there are better places if you're just looking for some good food.
Been here a couple of times. Staff is friendly and prices are reasonable.  Travel to Boulder on business every once in a while. Always stop by
reviewTitle: Fun place to chill by yourself

reviewText: Not bad- atmosphere great- burgers are burgers. Good portions and good music. Service was friendly. Would recommend - seems like they have activities at night but lunch was fine.

The food was awesome and the Drinks were great! Great old movie and country bar and grill theme.  Pool tables and darts, also live band. We bought a shirt and sweat shirt to have cool memories of this place.  We will be back!

Good place but definitely a college place. Self serve at both bar and kitchen when we came in. Fun experience but pretty sure I would have been a little daunted if I wasn't up for adventure. LOL

Menu is standard bar fare but the burgers are anything but standard. Good size and cooked perfectly, the choices are fun and somewhat eclectic. I had the avocado burger with green chilies but I was super tempted to go with the royale burger with smoked ham and an onion right. Not brave enough for the Jiffy burger with peanut butter but apparently it is a fave. Wife loved her patty melt and the child loved her quesadilla. Curly fries were good!

Place is loud and fun and full of laughter. Bathrooms are awesome. Lol
Stopped for lunch while dropping our son of at school.   The burgers are great. Everyone enjoyed theirs. Atmosphere is a bar.  Server was good.
You have to go to understand what a great environment and visual collection is here - and the quesidias are good too! They have a student menu, and offerings beyond burgers and fries.
Welcoming staff good burgers and great atmosphere day and night.Amazing collection of film memrobelia
I like their burgers on burger madness. A beer and a burger that are decent is awesome in my book so I can't complain

Nine of us showed up starving and ready for lunch after spending a few hours in Boulder Canyon. We settled in and started checking out the menu and ordered drinks ranging from beers to margaritas to water and iced tea.We ordered burgers, wings and fried cod and everyone liked their food. I stuck with a basic cheeseburger with fries and it was perfectly cooked and delicious. I drank a couple of cold Coors to celebrate my first visit to this pub since 1979. It doesn't appear to have changed much and is holding up extremely well.
Nice little place to hang out with your best friends or family.  Burgers made to your satisfaction with great selections. If your going to Boulder, you have to eat at the Dark  Horse.
very tasty beer and delicious burgers, extremely friendly staff and fast service, went there both nights we stayed in nearby Rodeway Inn
Awesome alive bar. Amazing eclectic decor is a must see. Great friendly and helpful staff and really good pub food. Well worth visiting if you're in the area

It was 96 degrees in Colorado when we were there. We stopped many times to cool off and gather our thoughts. We saw this sign proclaiming "The World Famous Dark Horse Bar" so ... you know. The bartender Mikey was not only on top of every wait staff order, he was tending to all the needs of patrons seated and needy. He made every single person feel like a priority and without ANY delay. He engaged in small talk up and down the bar and greeted people as they came in. This is the type of bartender we would steal when we open our own place. We only had drinks but heard the other customers compliment the food. We will definitely go again.
reviewTitle: Saw the sign that said famous so .....

reviewText: I've never been to a bar like this before. TONS of character and the bartenders were probably the nicest/best I've had in years and years. No smug hipsters at all and right next to our Motel. Definitely hang there again.

The evening started off great.  I was a little early and the Staff was so friendly and accommodating.  They had a happy hour menu where I was able to order my starter/appetizer.  I had the steak tartar.  It was fabulous.  Good seasoning and good size.  Only small comment would be the duck egg was cute and a novelty, but I like the yoke of an egg to bind the tartar a bit and give it that creaminess.  The duck egg is so small it was more for looks than adding to the flavor. I followed the tartar with traditional escargot, again excellent.  They offer a different presentation but chose the traditional version and I was happy that I did.  Then things started to fall apart.  I had a martini cocktail which I enjoyed, but I trying to cut back on drinking so much and asked for a non-alcoholic beverage, any juice or soft drink would be fine.  I was told they had nothing but water unless I wanted to order a non-alcoholic cocktail from the bar. I paid the extra money for a fruity non-alcoholic cocktail that I didn't really want just to get something non-alcoholic.  I wondered, if the cocktail has fruit juice, why couldn't I have had just the fruit juice. Big strike.
     I had the duck confit or Cassoulet de Canard Confit.  It was extremely dry.  Way over cooked. The dry duck leg was served on very dry breadcrumbs - yes, breadcrumbs.  No sauce at all. Over half the dish was undressed frisee salad.  Huge disappointment.  Surprise! I was able to order black coffee (which is non-alcoholic).  I would have been happy if it was offered earlier as a non-alcoholic beverage.  
  I recently moved up from the Denver Tech Center and the wonderful restaurants around there.  I was looking for a new go-to place for a quiet excellent dinner closer to my new home.  It will not be Bistro Vendome.  I'll keep looking.
  Recommend for starters and cocktails, but not dinner.
reviewTitle: Mixed Experience - Good and Bad Points - Don't go if you don't drink alcohol.

reviewText: We liked the setting, since we were not burdened with the memories of the Larimer Square location.  It's nice to have the outdoor option on a warm evening.  We were outlanders in a sea of celebrating sophisticates, so we were a bit taken aback by the self-conscious "we are the elites" vibe of the clientele.  Some people in Park Hill are very snooty in a progressive urban way.  The staff was very nice in the main, and down to earth.   Our waiter kept us waiting for our wine order while moseying around on other tasks.  The prices were a touch high, yet not incongruent w/ the quality of the food and service.
reviewTitle: Decent Cuisine a Tad Pretentious Area

reviewText: Bistro Vendome offers a delicious meal, friendly and attentive staff, and inventive cocktails. The souffle (which happens to be gluten-free) was AMAZING!
reviewTitle: Great meal at a fair price

reviewText: We ordered the duck pate as an appetizer. What was served to us a liver mousse spread on a piece of toast and it tasted paste-like and way too rich. My husband ordered steak au poirve and he got chewy steak with no pepper sauce at all. All he got was a tasteless grilled steak. I ordered trout and it was doused with French liquid butter and had no flavor. We were very disappointed and will not come back. We love French food and were always pleased until we had dined here. If you want even just food French food, skip this restaurant.

I was disappointed in the food at this  restaurant and felt that it expensive for what we got.  My husband and I had the Salad De Chicory and that was very good,  but my husband and our friend got Grilled Hangar Steak which they both said was very tough.   I got pan seared scallops and they were good but they were small and there were only three of them.   The service was very good and manager did give a us a discount because of the steak.

What a lovely spot to have a meal. So much better than their downtown location. Full of light and great acoustics (hard to fine now a days). The Eggs in Purgatory were spicy and perfectly done, but too much grilled bread as a side. The Steak tartar was an hit with potato chips.  Best omelets in town! The only down was we forgot to order the bacon crispy. The sangria was really really  delicious. If anyone that reads this review has the recipe for it I would love to have it.

BV accommodated our request for a quiet table. This was appreciated as a member of our party is very hard-of-hearing. Ambiance is meh ... doesn't have a French bistro vibe (which its former residence in downtown Denver did), but the interior is okay once you realize it's not what you may have expected. I may have sat in less comfortable chairs, but if so, don't recall. Failing upgraded seating, lumbar cushions would be welcome. Food and service were very good across-the-board. The carrot bisque special, steak frites, escarole salad, moules, chicken terrine and tart citron were all good to excellent. The wine list bows to the bistro theme by being exclusively French. A $116 2016 Paulliac from a Chateau I'm unfamiliar with did not disappoint. Server Courtney was excellent: friendly, competent, professional, knowledgeable and not intrusive. We'll be back.
We are a family with children and this was a very good experience for all of us.  We had everything from french fries to roasted scallops and pork grille.

Excellent service great atmosphere fantastic food I had been there before this experience was is good or better than my first experience to us ordered the scallops which were wonderful appetizers were delightful third guest in our party ordered steak au povre which was also outstanding highly recommend for anyone visiting Denver

I've traveled to France a number of times and other French speaking coutries and love all things French, so was excited to try this restaurant which I've been hearing raves about for years.  I'm also a foodie and respect Jennifer Jasinski whose name is a part of this place.   Anyway, my husband and I went for an early dinner on a Sunday evening, and we appreciated that in their new location in Park Hill, the parking situation is way better than downtown.  I would have loved to sit outside on their patio, but it's located in the front of the restaurant and therefore you get neighborhood noise and street noise, so we opted for indoors.  We were seated at a nice window table and we also had a view of the kitchen which is kind of fun if you're a foodie, until one of the kitchen staff rolled her eyes when our server asked for a substitution on my entree.  Manager, please instruct your staff that people can see them and their facial expressions.  Our server Christopher was very nice and attentive.  I wasn't a fan of him upselling us on the $4 'butter service' talking about how the butter is from Normandy.   My husband is a bread eater, and if you're going to upsell us on a butter service, bring a delicious piece of bread to go with this special butter.  My husband said the bread was mediocre.  Disappointing.  We both ordered salads - chicoree/frisee with chunks of apple and goat cheese for my husband and arugula with macadamia nuts and shallots with a Palisade peach vinaigrette for me.  We both agreed as we drove home that the salads were the most interesting thing we ate  - tasty preparations and well dressed.  The menu is limited, definitely French fare, but not the best we've ever had.  We shared two different entrees - hanger steak frites and grilled pork tenderloin.  A staple of French cooking is sauce work and I'll give it to them because the sauces were very tasty.  But at the end of the day for what we had, we were both underwhelmed by the overall experience.
reviewTitle: Don't understand what all the fuss is about but new location better for quiet and parking

reviewText: This brunch was wonderful. One of our guests had many dietary restrictions and the restaurant was very accommodating. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. I highly recommend.

Great brunch. We were on the patio. Server Courtney was amazing; a real pro. Omelette was perfect, Pain et Beurre and Tomato Bisque were delicious and my wife loved her Crepe us Citron. The Ladoucette Pouilly-Fume complimented perfect! Love the new location. The restaurant is beautiful. Can’t wait to come back!

We ate at this restaurant when it was located downtown. It used to be very good.  Pasta tagliatelle was cold, very salty and the pasta way undercooked. The rabbit was cold and not very tasty. The service was very good.

We had wanted to try "Bistro Vendome" for a while after seeing it in the city originally, then realizing it had moved to Kearney Street in Park Hill we decided to go and give it a go in it's newer location.  We have very mixed feelings about our dining experience.  I had booked a table about 3 weeks in advance, online, only to find out that our small table was right in the area of the front counter, and it felt like we were sitting with the people that were coming in to check in, and while they stood waiting they were a part of our sitting area and dining experience - initially super uncomfortable until "zoned" them out!!  :(  They need to totally REMOVE THIS TABLE  - the placement of this table is dreadful as a diner and diners paying a good price for their food. They couldn't move us, because they were too busy when we inquired about this.  My recommendation is if you want to sit it a particular area call the restaurant don't book it online and take a chance like we did and end up at the front desk (call them).  Our waiter Howard, however, was excellent, as a server - super friendly and welcoming, and knowledgable of the menu.  However, some of the staff need a little more training.  Even though they were all lovely we were a little surprised when for instance one of the servers refilling our water glasses slopped it all over the table, made a joke of it and felt no need to wipe it up, simply left the water all over the table and walked off.  My husband had the chicken main which he said was very ordinary in appearance and flavor, and I had the trout which was delicious.  Again though we were very surprised by the presentation when it arrived at our table, extremely underwhelming for both in appearance for a restaurant that looks like "Bistro Vendome".  Both dishes simply looked like a piece of protein and salad made at home.  The dessert we ordered and shared was delicious - we had the black forest cake.  The Veuve Vernay Brut Rose that I ordered was perfectly chilled and delicious.  So we came away with very mixed feelings about Bistro Vendome which is very disappointing - we really wanted to like it but we came away feeling on the whole that we had a very average experience and by no means will we be rushing back.  For two mains, two drinks and one dessert it cost around $115 before a tip.
reviewTitle: Mixed Emotions for Bistro Vendome - Average

reviewText:
… you may be asked to leave by the manager.  

We arrived 20 minutes early on a Saturday evening for our reservation, and were seated promptly as we were the first seating for the dinner round.  We had previewed the menu ahead of time and knew what items were drool worthy so we set out to embark on this culinary experience by ordering everything at once as soon as our very friendly server arrived.  The steak tartare arrived with a side of chips and my wife, who’s eaten many, thought it was one of the best she’s had.  I’m not much into raw meat but I really liked the flavor of the chips. The French onion soup was great with the right amount of toastiness to the bread and an excellent Gruyère covering it all. Not overly salty like you get in some places.   
While waiting for round 2 to arrive we enjoyed the French bread with a sweet creamy butter that brought back memories of our time in the Loire valley.  Then came the Lamb Navarin which is the most expensive item on their menu but well worth the cost.  It was slow cooked and so tender you could cut it with a spoon.  It was topped with a turnip green pistou that gave a very fresh spring flavor to the meat.  We ordered a side of Pommes Frites and were glad we did as it had the most amazing sweet salty flavor you don’t expect in standard fries, as they toss the fries in a mixture of sugar and champagne to apply a nice coating. I wouldn’t advise asking for ketchup as you’ll lose the flavor of this exotic variation of fries.  The bottle of red from Chinon we ordered complemented every course well and I recommend that if you are stuck looking for the right pairing. 
After completing the main meal we were quite full but very content, so when the server brought out the dessert menu we quickly ordered the chocolate soufflé. I mean how could you not?  It said on the menu to give it 20 minutes to come out, which was perfect as that would give us enough time to free up a little space for this final round of gastronomic gluttony, as well as agree that we are definitely coming back here for our anniversary. 
It was during this 20 minute wait that the manager came to our table and curtly told us that they had promised the table to another couple soon, suggesting that we please wrap it up.    Wait, WHAT??  We’ve been eating nonstop since appetizers arrived and now we’re being kicked out as they think we’re just tying up a table for the evening?  He clearly hadn’t done his due diligence and ask our server for a status update on the soufflé first. This was the equivalent of being shaken awake during a wonderful dream.  At that point our entire experience soured so we decided not to spend another minute there, soufflé or not. 

As food and experience are weighted evenly in my reviews, I’d have to give the food 5 stars and the experience negative 1 star, which is a shame as this final rating does not reflect the perfection attained by the chef and wait staff who are really the ones that get all the credit.
reviewTitle: Don’t order the chocolate soufflé or…

reviewText: This restaurant has moved to Park Hill from Larimer Square: 2267 Kearney St, Denver, CO 80207. My wife and I had brunch here yesterday and we both loved it. Fabulous food and coffee. We're going back for dinner soon!
reviewTitle: Great French food in a cute corner of Park Hill

reviewText: I made a reservation 2 months beforehand. When we arrived we had to wait 45 minutes past our scheduled reservation to be seated. We were seated near a large, uncurtained window, on a cold evening, so we had to keep our coats on, in spite of the heater in our corner (which we had to turn on). Food and wine were overpriced and underwhelming. I had the onion tart - the shell was lined with way too much mustard, overpowering the carmelized onion flavor. I also ordered a french garlic soup - it was not very different from a typical french onion soup, but mercifully, less salty than others I've had. My son's steak was chewy, and the duck my parents shared was very fatty and dry. My husband, who has dietary restrictions and couldn't eat most of what was on the menu, ordered a salad and the seafood soup, and left quite hungry. The frites were good, at least. But well over $300 feels like far to much to pay for acceptable french fries.  Try Lucina instead, 2 doors down, for a unique and satisfying dining experience.
reviewTitle: Won't be returning to this one.

reviewText: Love the new location of this iconic restaurant. Beautiful space and the food is better than ever. Had the French Onion soup, Steak Tartare, and Sweetbreads. All were awesome. Excellent wines; had the Ott Provence rose that was suggested by my server; Beautiful and a great pairing with the sweetbreads. Service was great. Excellent experience!
reviewTitle: New location is better than ever

reviewText: We never had dinner here because we were not aware of the new location when we called. We thought they were still located on Larimer. Wish they had said something when I made a reservation over the phone. They need to communicate better!!!!

Came here before the ballet, right at opening time. Cocktails were excellent (the granddaughter and I had a non-alcoholic version of the Bee Sneeze, other members of our party had the Manhattan Vendome and the alcoholic Bee Sneeze, we were all very happy with our drinks). We had pate, tarte aux tomates and moules (mussels) for appetizers, all so good and we asked for more toast points to enjoy the broth from the mussels. For main course we ordered the duck, the trout, the steak with frites and the risotto, everyone was very happy with their choices. Only the granddaughter had dessert, the caramel apple cheesecake, she enjoyed it immensely. And we had plenty of time to relax and truly enjoy our meal, no pressure from the wait staff. Our waiter was patient and attentive, excellent all around. Will definitely follow them to their new location in Park Hill.

Awesome spot to get food after a long ride. The brisket sandwich was the best brisket I have ever had in Colorado. Our friends had the burgers and they said they were good as well. We will definitely be back. :)

Ate here three times during our stay in Pitkin. The burgers and chicken sandwiches were both excellent. Enough fries for at least 2 or 3 people! Love eating outside under the cover. Large tables to accomidate families.
worth the stop, came here on my way north. like the open atmosphere and the service was exceptional.
On our recent trip to Taylor Park we ate here on 2 occasions. We both had the burgers (very good and large) the first trip and brisket sandwich the second trip. Both very good. Fries are so-so.

Stopped at this place while riding motorcycles through the mountain passes and trails with a couple of friends.  You order from a food trailer and then eat at picnic table under a semi enclosed canopy attached to the food trailer.  Simple food like burgers and pulled pork sandwiches, fries, etc.  Everything is made to order and reasonably priced.
Great food when coming off a day or morning of ATV riding! We love the Silver Plume and will be back again and again!
reviewTitle: Best Burgers come from the Mountains!

reviewText: Then try a burger or a hotdog here at the Silver Plume grill....maybe it's just me but I think they taste even better because of this sweet mountain air!
Great hot dogs, burgers and smiles with your service.  A must stop when ATVIng in the Rockies. Prices good and service top drawer

This is a great pit stop for your day in Pitkin.  The burger was fantastic and the general store had most of the basics and then some!  The covered outdoor dining area is just the ticket for a surprise down pour or relief from shade.  Highly recommended!
Food is good and the service is great. Nice open air place to eat and relax. I had a great time there while we stayed in Pitkin
Covered pavilion is nice with picnic tables. Had BLT, bacon was abundant, well cooked. People are friendly, knowledgeable about area, lots to see nearby. Check out General Store, chairs on porch.
reviewTitle: Dining in Pitkin, slow down, enjoy

reviewText: The brisket sandwich was really good and we know brisket.  The service was great. A perfect lunch stop if you're in Pitkin.
Good food and fun for my daughter with board games at each table the service was very friendly and respectful.

The Grill is next door to the Siver Plume.  The people make this  stop in Pitkin great.  The grill you can pick up a meal and visit with other outdoor folks while waiting.  The Plume trading post offers a number of things including gasoline, ice cream, information, collectibles, clothing, etc.
We were hungry after a day out on the RZRs and the burgers and fries were great!  We had great service too and my kids enjoyed playing checkers too!  Thank you!!

This grill is like its adjacent general store—high quality in every way. The burgers were fresh; the accompanying fries were homestyle. Very tasty. Yes, one might consider the fare a bit pricey, but it avoids a trip to Gunnison (not exactly up-the-road) and one pays for convenience. Love the adjacent eating area, with fresh plants on the tables. Cheerful atmosphere! Staff in the grill kitchen friendly and hospitable. They want the best for the area and do anything they can for the guest. Just love everything about the Silver Plume.

It's a beautiful ride along Quartz Creek and when the pavement stops you've reached the Silver Plume Grill. It was loaded with dirt bikers and off-roaders when I arrived, but the grill handled the rush well and everyone under the tent seemed very happy with their lunches. Good burger, friendly people.
Great burgers and frys. Friendly staff.always accommodating. The store is also great and it's nice to find gas for our atv's and utv.
The fries were yummy!  During our stay in Pitkin we enjoyed the hot dog and burgers!   Nice stop before or after hitting the trail!

Such a fun little place. The burgers are wonderful! But, this was the first time to have the brisket. Wow, very tinder and tasty. Like melt in your mouth tinder. Also Had an order of fries. They were also freshly cooked.
The service was also very friendly. Will definitely stop in for a bite any time we are in the area!
Also, be sure to check out all the fun stuff they have in the little general store!

My travel companion and I had the pleasure of having dinner here one evening after our original dinner plan fell through.  We feel like we got the better deal.  A very quaint courtyard and room right off Larimer Square (you could walk by this and completely miss it).  We have been to France several times, and this just FELT like we were there right from the get-go.  We could have been in Paris.

Our table was in the courtyard and felt like private dining to us, as we were away from anyone else.  However the staff were in constant rotation, making sure that everything was fine, without being intrusive - just what I would expect from a place like this.

The charcuterie plate was really tasty, the Steak Tartare wonderfully prepared, the Moules Frites were excellent and the Boudin Blanc was flavourful, even down to the cabbage.

This was a real treat of an experience!  Highly recommend.

We enjoyed an impromptu dinner here on a Friday night. The place was fully booked but the host managed 2 seats for us at the bar.  We enjoyed delicious moules frites, a favorite of ours in France, accompanied by tasty appetizers and a good Bordeaux. We enjoyed ourselves so much we returned for brunch on Sunday!  Fun atmosphere, pleasant staff, lots of charm.

hot stuffy air.  slow waiter.  very average  overpriced food. trying very hard to be french but not even close...only plus is the  the charming facility itself and location in Larimer  Square.  if you have been to France and liked it there...do not go to this restaurant.  like many restaurants, it is faux french

Starts with a great happy hour menu 4-6 M-TH. Bargains on drinks and apps. Courtyard in summet, inside in winter. Either way the atmosphere is tops. Knowledgeable waiters who know their menu well. The moules are excellent as is the country pate. You could easily make a meal just off the happy hr menu.   For the mains, trout, roasted chicken, duck confit or steak and frites are all on point. Cheeses and dessert also do not disappoint. Always a pleasant place to spend the evening.

Nice little bistro with simple menu done well.  Inside and outside dining in an arcade off Larimer offers a range of slightly different choices.  We didn't have starters but would have had the steak tartare or the pate or the yellow fin tuna if we hadn't shared a seasoned dressed green salad.  We enjoyed steak frites, duck confit with peaches, leeks and mushrooms, and boudin sausage with pear and cabbage.  We had brussel sprouts with almonds as a side.  We enjoyed excellent  cheese, a ginger and lychee dessert and a glass of good chilled sauternes.  Very nice and recommended!

This is such a charming location. Sit outdoors. I uncharacteristic ordered the flank steak. I hardly ever eat beef. It was wonderful! Our server was informative and personable. 
Perfect evening

Came in unexpectedly for a late afternoon drink when we saw the inviting courtyard from the street, and we were so happy we did.  Well prepared drinks, excellent appetizers and genuinely friendly and attentive service. Hidden away inside the courtyard its got a real European feel. Not traveling to France much these days, so this place is the next best thing.
Very cute bistro. Had the onion soup, steak tartar, salad, mussels, duck and steak frites. All were very good. Some dinner plates came with apps so that was annoying but otherwise no company’s.

Off the beaten path, one might miss this gem.  Lovely ambiance.  Wonderful cuisine.  Excellent staff, solicitous, helpful -- their recommendations were outstanding.  The perfect pairings of dishes with wine.  I can't wait until my next visit to Denver so I can enjoy the food and service of this fine establishment.

What a French gem tucked away on Larimer St!!  Greeted and served by the most friendliest and attentive waiter, Matt.  French  onion soup and steak frites were excellent (get the champagne gastric seasoned frites).  Compliments to the pastry chef - the chocolate soufflé was one of the best we’ve had.  Not a surprise that this bistro has been around for 20 years already.  Can’t wait to get back to Denver to dine here again!

Bonne restaurant.  
Quaint spot off Larimer with friendly staff and excellent food.   Enjoyed brunch offerings of crepes, drinks and duck confit.   The cheese options are unique as was the fig spread.  Will definitely return.

We loved our visit to Bistro Vendome.  The food is prepared in a traditional manner with some innovative touches.  No one in our party of six was disappointed with any of their choices, which included items from all of the food groupings on the menu.  The prices were moderate, considering the recent rise in all food pricing.  The wine list was extensive, with many wines also available by the glass.  Service was professional and attentive, with the waiter prepared to answer all of our questions about the menu.  We will return.

Waitress neglected to tell us about the daily specials. Drinks took forever. Steak frites was undercooked & pork belly was still cold in the middle. Waitress never checked in with us to find out how our meals were. Significant delay in arrival of second glass of wine.

Nice French Bistro vibe and the food was excellent. The staff knowledgeable and accommodating.  We had the special starter for that day and split a dessert. My husband had the duck which was suburb and I had the pork belly. We'd definitely go back!

Steak Frites were served raw when they were ordered medium rare and the Bearnaise sauce was hard and cold.  The Duck was good, but not great.  The Steak Tar Tar and the Onion Soup were Excellent.  The manager made adjustments to discount the check and offered a desert on the house for the problems with the meals.
Great place to be, beautiful seating, especially outside. Food was great! Staff very nice and accommodating. Would definitely come back whenever we visit Denver!

Amazing dinner at Bistro Vendome. We had a taste of the gazpacho, followed by the French onion soup, a great kale salad, and we both went with the duck for dinner. We finished the meal with French press coffee and split the dessert. It was a so nice and loved the atmosphere and the food. 

For dress code, I saw a variety of attire. We both wore nice jeans and a button down, and a polo and was just fine. There was business casual and jackets and cocktail dresses. Just use good judgement but I wouldn’t stress too much. 

This was absolutely a special evening and experience. The Ambience, service, food quality, flavors, and presentation was perfect. Such a wonderful evening. It was an intimate yet social atmosphere. Our server, Rachel was the absolute best.
reviewTitle: Perfect experience, service, and delicious food!

reviewText: Nice tucked away French restaurant off festive Larimer St. This was our 2nd visit and did not disappoint. Very good and knowledgeable waitress. Nice wine selection. We started with mussels. Had pork loin as entrees and very tender and tasty. Chocolate soufflé is a must to cap it off!
Enjoyable Sunday brunch with delicious food. Especially enjoyed the bottomless mimosas. 😊 The outdoor area is lovely.

I arrived on a frigid night, but the staff and atmosphere gave me a warm feeling quickly.  I will be the first to admit that French cooking is one of my favorites.  Before dining on Vendome’s almond crusted trout I enjoyed a very well mixed “Manhattan Noir” which was a delightfully smooth bourbon drink.  I coupled that with their warm flavorful French union soup which was not too salty.  

Given the cold I thought it was only appropriate to order a chocolate soufflé and that arrived warm and rich.  The restaurant definitely has a French cafe feel with its design.  More importantly, the staff made the visit and were very welcoming.  When visiting Larimar square this is one of the restaurants I suggest.
Enjoyed a good hot meal after a long day of riding.  If you're lucky enough to get to these town's definitely plan on eating here!

Been here in 2014 and 2016, it is a great stop after being on the trail all day. The burgers are great, BBQ brisket and sauce is made there and excellent. Everything I've had has been excellent. Ice cream and gas is available at the accompanying Silver Plume General Store. Stop, it's worth it.
Always great food, served with a smile! The hand made picnic tables are the perfect touch for the mountain setting!

If you're traveling through the mountain passes near Pitkin, or just passing through to Gunnison I would HIGHLY recommend the Silver Plume Grill! The food is amazing, and the service is really nice! Definitely a do-over!
A little pricey, but when you consider the cost to truck everything over 20 miles from the nearest town, the massive amount of food per order, and the quality of the food, 100% worth every penny!
Great burger, pulled pork sandwich and fries.   The owners are there cooking and visiting with guests.   The food is delicious and you should stop by and try it out!!

I stopped at the Silver Plume Grill for a carry out burger so I wouldn't have to cook dinner. The burger was huge, on a fresh bun and the fixings were delicious. What a joy to find an amazing burger in the mountains and the service was quick and very friendly.

I ate lunch there, the weather was great and I sat in the picnic type  area they had setup.  Could see the mountains and tree around.  Talked with some friendly locals and other travelers. The grill is close by the room I stayed at.  I came back this way again during a break in the day.  Cheese burger and fries in the mountains was nice, can't wait to bring my family on the next trip.

We ate at the grill multiple times during our stay in Pitkin. The brisket was perfect and the breakfast was quick and delicious. A perfect way to start the day.  The family that runs Silver Plume is really a nice group of people.  The kind of people you like to be around.

Thank you Silver Plume
reviewTitle: Great Great People - Great Great Food

reviewText: Best food and service on the mountain!!! I feel like I sample half the menu and everything was like a home cooked meal.

This is a very cozy and quaint restaurant. We had dinner there in September for our family of 4. Since this was during the pandemic, the tables were spaced out really well and we felt very safe. It has a warm and welcoming atmosphere-- you feel like you are in a  local restaurant in a  French village.
Every course was fantastic-- do not miss the cream of mushroom soup-- the best we have ever had. We had the duck and the trout-- both were fantastic. There is an excellent wine list and the service was top notch. I can't recommend this cozy restaurant enough if you want a romantic evening  out, or just a delicious meal with great service.

This french bistro hit the spot during a record Colorado heat wave. The adorable courtyard is shaded and cool. 

We had brunch and it was delicious. Classic beignets with apricots and dream, crepes Florentine and eggs Benedict made for the perfect Sunday afternoon. 

Mmmmmmm.
reviewTitle: Adorable European courtyard in the heart of Denver.

reviewText:
My wife and I made the journey here out of a sudden craving of escargots, which arrived in their six individual, butter-filled dimples.  They simply melted in your mouth while simultaneously bursting with flavor enhanced by minuscule morsels of minced garlic. Craving satisfied with aplomb!

The main dish of steak frites was cooked to juicy medium-rare perfection as well, with a light-crisp pepper crust accenting Vendome's aupoivre sauce. Every bite provided a rich hit of the steak's essence while not feeling as absurdly filling as other cuts of meat. The fries had such a nice crunch and saltiness to complement and round out the offering. The bistro nails this dish. 

Looking across the entirety of Bistro Vendome from the rear banquette, it's hard not to realize that you're just a narrow corridor away from Denver's storied Larimer Street. Even though a tourist set bustles nearby, there's a genuine ambiance about the dining room that almost feeds more flavor into the staples of French cuisine that adorn the straightforward menu. Grab a glass beaujolais, relax, and add a little bit to the light cacophony of various conversations peppering the room.

This good looking little restaurant is located in a very nice area of Larimer street where options are plentiful. The food was ok but simply did not meet our expectations. Service was below the widespread standards of restaurants of this status where you anticipate that at least wine should be served after the first pouring by the waiter and suggest if you want more wine especially when there are four persons at your party.

Service and food is always excellent. This time round celebrating an anniversary, staff was very attentive and spoiled us with a free desert to share. We let our server know we were attending a show later in the evening. They inquired what time we needed to be done, and made sure we enjoyed our starter, entree, desert and coffee without feeling rushed and with time to spare. Bistro Vendome is our go to restaurant when we we are in Denver.

A Denver local highly recommended this charming restaurant in Larimer Square. I loved it! Bistro Vendome is cozy, elegant and relaxed. The service is superb.

Our server, Aaron was very attentive and made excellent food and wine recommendations from their wonderful menu. The scallops were light and tasty and the Pavlova and blueberry tarte were wonderful.

Can't wait to go back!

Just off Larimer Square, there is nothing nicer than having a Sunday evening meal outside.  The mussels and pomme frites are a great way to end an afternoon of seeing the sights in LoDo.  Serive is good, but get there early if you want to dine al fresco

Overall I was not happy with my experience at this restaurant. The service was slow and the server made errors. The restaurant does not identify gluten free menu items, and although I requested that the lavash crackers be omitted from the cheese plate, that did not happen. The server made us feel unwelcome in the restaurant. 

I went to the restaurant for dinner with a business colleague. We were seated at a small table in a small front room with with a large window to my right and a wall of wine bottles behind me. There there were no other customers in the room. We had to move the two-person table a bit closer to the wall to make room to sit down. During the meal, the waiter came to get a bottle of wine from the wall, and I asked how he could get the bottles near the top. He said he usually stood on a chair. Since my chair was the closest to the wall, that seemed to mean that he usually stood on the chair that I was sitting on. At the end of the meal, a few minutes before we were ready to leave, the waiter asked us to move to an adjacent table that had been empty during our entire stay at the restaurant. 

When ordering the cheese plate, I explained to the server that I have a wheat allergy and didn't want the lavash crackers, and he seemed to understand, because he advised me not to order the chickpea fries, due to cross contamination in the frying oil. However, when the plate came, the crackers were on it, and half of the plate was covered with wheat crumbs. While the cheese itself was good, I was not able to enjoy it while worrying about wheat contamination. The vegetarian salad I ordered was edible, but not memorable, and unlike the high quality vegetables that I have eaten at more casual restaurants in Denver.
reviewTitle: Poor choice for gluten free or vegetarian, unfriendly

reviewText: I have always liked, but never loved, French food. However, this restaurant was amazing! The escargot was delicious, the serving sizes were perfect, and the duck and steak were to die for... highly recommend!
One of the best hidden jewel in Denver. Top class French cuisine and extensive win list. Very cozy and excellent service. Will go back.

For five of us, the service, food and atmosphere were wonderful. For one person in our party, who has a severe gluten allergy, the dinner was a disaster. She told the waiter that she was celiac, and despite assurances that the items she ordered were indeed gluten-free, she experienced a severe reaction to her meal 10 minutes after leaving the restaurant. This morning, the manager promptly returned our voicemail from last night, and while courteous and reassured us that all of the items were indeed gluten-free, she repeatedly remarked that they are not a celiac kitchen and it must be cross-contamination. Being a French restaurant, she remarked, they used a lot more gluten-based products than most restaurants (e.g. baguettes). We spent weeks this past summer in France and Italy and never had an issue. My conclusion, if you don't have a gluten/celiac issue, you'll have a marvelous dining experience; if you do have a gluten/celiac issue, I'd stay away. As an aside, the manager never offered to compensate the one person's meal or make any other efforts beyond stating "we are not a celiac kitchen."

Went there two consecutive nights duck and steak frites both excellent with a small but terrific desert menu All well prepared and reasonably priced We’ll definitely go back next time we’re in Denver!

The atmosphere of Bistro Vendome, tucked away in Larimer Square, is perfect for a Sunday brunch—very French with scenic gardens and cozy tables. But the food is the star here: fantastic onion soup (so nice that they split one order into 2 cups), flavor balanced root vegetable and bacon crepe with herbed hollandaise sauce, and superb quiche with veggies and cheese. The French press is super flavorful too. 
Service is helpful and attentive, prices are commensurate with the food quality.

Went here for our anniversary after seeing the Monet exhibit.  The chicken was the most tender, juiciest I ever had and the Roquefort steak was incredible.  The pommes frites had so many layers of flavor.  My husband had the creme brulee and I had the chocolate souffle - delicious!  After all that, plus drinks and coffee, it was surprisingly reasonably priced.  Can't wait to try this place again!

Recently, a group of us went to Sunday brunch.  The bloody were good ,though  not a lot of garnish. The worse part of meal was , tow of the ladies did not get there meal until most of us had finished. None of the food was very good, the onion coup being the best of what I tasted.  the sent over a little plate of donuts for mishap but because they gave the two dishes to someone else and kind of ruined art, they should hav refunded at least one, not a plate of unhealthy do not holes. Will not be back

Had brunch here on Sunday with long time friends, one of whom was in for a visit from New York. Everything was excellent, the food, the service, the atmosphere made for a truly enjoyable gathering. And the courtyard served up the opportunity for some nice post-meal photos!

Wonderful service, beautiful restaurant. We visited before a show on our anniversary. The server was very helpful, she let us know which dishes probably wouldn’t work with our time frame. Our carrot appetizer was delicious, came out very fast, only criticism is that it was a little sauce heavy for the amount of whole carrots. We split the classic steak frites to cut down on time. The server(sorry I can’t remember her name) had the kitchen split our dish before coming out rather than just giving us an extra plate, very thoughtful! And because we didn’t have time for dessert(I was very disappointed) she gave us a coupon for a free dessert at our next visit. And that coupon will be used, we will be back!

Escargot good but seasoned with Pernod so a new taste sensation. Onion soup ok. Chicken special was delicious. Potatoes and kale served cold but wait staff delivered new order of hot potatoes and kale. No happy hour price on house wine. $15 a glass. Wish waiter suggested a bottle, but was delicious!

A group of 8 of us had dinner while in town for a conference. The staff were very friendly and the food was delicious. I had the trout with a cider. Everyone seemed happy with their food. The only down side was they spilt the wine everyone else drank between all of us, so I was charged $15 extra, but seemed like too much of a hassle to make them correct it.

My wife is from Germany & lived in Paris a year so when she says it is the best mussels she has had in the USA, that is a compliment. 
Brunch so I had omelette & croissant which were great.
Doesn’t get any better.  Service and great food, exactly what you want. Other places might give you flashy and good food, Bistro Vendome is classycjjust pprprovides you with

Très déçu par ce restaurant Francais à Denver.Cuisine bien moyenne .Peut être nous n'avons pas réussi ce jour en retenant au Vendome , mais ce restaurant ne restera pas
dans nos mémoires.

We enjoyed a wonderful meal at Bistro Vendome, truly a hidden gem off Larimer Square in downtown Denver. (located behind main storefronts).  We started off with soup l'oignon, which was refreshingly not as salty as it is often served and a lovely salad with melon.  We followed with duck confit and steak au poivre and frites.  The steak and duck were cooked to perfection and the frites were the best I ever had.  They had a slightly sweet taste (sugar, perhaps?)  Our server was great and suggested glasses of wine for each of us which paired perfectly with our meals.  Top it off with creme brulee for dessert and you have a wonderful French dinner in a restaurant that feels like you are on a small street in Paris.  Although it was too cool to dine outside, there is a lovely patio which we have enjoyed on other visits during warmer months.
reviewTitle: Literally a hidden gem in Denver

reviewText:
Great weather for outside Brunch - delightful.
Would recommend Salade Nicoise,Moules and Crepes du Jour.
Saff said the most popular plate was Oeufs Benedicte and witnessed several during serving,
Plate presentation looked awesome..
A group of 8 and we stopped at this restaurant.  A good choice overall.  Service was top notch, very attentive and friendly.  Food was very tasty and definitely a place to come back to.

I had a wonderful dinner at Bistro Vendome.  It was a beautiful evening, I sat outside on the patio.  

The bartender made me a wonderful cocktail--a classic negroni.  

Then I had some small plates.   The beef tartare, roasted carrots and a salad.  All were very good.

Even though I was dining alone, the servers treated me with respect and allowed me to dine.

It was a wonderful meal.

My sweetie was working in downtown Denver for the month of August. During his evening walk around town he would stop at this quaint French restaurant, read the menu, ring my cell and say " Can't wait for you to arrive to Denver, found the perfect place for your birthday dinner, you are going to love it!!" Reservations made: I found it very charming with a European ambiance, however our 1st hor d'oeuvre was the chicken liver mousse, it had a flavor neither of us cared for and had never tasted. We asked to try the Pate Vendome which was a hit. Plats Principaux : Bouillabaisse  & Confit de Canard. The duck was dry, the broth of the bouillabaisse was nothing special!  From there it was on to the desert. Creme Brulee, again, had better! The disappointment was twofold the food and secondly,not one person acknowledged this was a birthday dinner! Last comment: white linens on the tables would improve the dining experience.

Very French ambience, and beautiful outdoor courtyard seating when the weather permits.  Great location on Larimer Square.  Very comfortable, casually elegant.  Not a wide-ranging menu, but very good food and great service.  The fries are very decadent!
reviewTitle: A corner of Paris in downtown Denver

reviewText:
A very sophisticated and friendly restaurant. We had a group of 5,  who wanted to talk more than eat. The wait staff was very patient and accommodating! 
If you want the chicken please know that it takes 30 minutes. Your colleagues may be eating before you!
The bread was warm and delicious. The meal was beautifully presented! 
We Jared desserts which were delightful to behold as they were to consume.

This has been our favorite restaurant in Denver for years but tonight’s visit was not as wonderful as usual. it was the first time my dinner was not good. I did not even like two of the three ice cream selections and I never leave ice cream behind. I ordered salmon which was warm, no longer hot, as if it had been sitting out and waiting to be served. It was over cooked and dry around the edges, served on an odd sauce that was a little bitter with a slight burnt taste.
The Panzanella salad was excellent and my husband liked his duck very much.
Wait staff was pleasant, attentive and helpful. I asked our server if there was a new chef in the kitchen and he told me no, but that the current chef was leaving next week.

I always recommended this restaurant for any occasion but tonight’s experience makes me reconsider.
This restaurant is tucked away and quiet.  It is elegant with wonderful menu.  I so enjoyed the atmosphere and the staff is amazing.  A great restaurant in a great location.  Try it!
reviewTitle: Wonderful French restaurant in the heart of Larimer Square!

reviewText: The patio is beautiful and quiet. We ordered small plates and thoroughly enjoyed every one of them. The cheeses were interesting and flavorful, and the melon salad had such a creative combination of elements! It was so much more than I expected. The creme brulee was delicious, and paired with the fresh french press coffee, a fantastic finish to a great experience.
reviewTitle: Great for small plates and patio conversation

reviewText: We wanted a quick dinner before a show so we ordered just three dishes. I had the onion soup, which was bland with no real depth of flavor, so it was just okay. The panzanella salad suffered from way too much red wine vinegar, making it much too acidic to be enjoyable. My wife actually mentioned this to our waitress, Mellanie (who was terrific, by the way), and I can’t remember any other time she complained to someone at a restaurant about her food. The final dish was the special, lemon gnocchi. Unfortunately, it was overcooked into mush and was doused in chili oil, which totally overwhelmed the subtle lemon flavor. It was a disappointing meal from a highly rated restaurant run by a talented chef.
reviewTitle: I really wanted to give them 4 or 5 stars, but...

reviewText: Great location. You really feel like being in Paris. Had the steak tartare which was very good although I would like a little more intensity kn the flavor. Creme brulee was great and bug portion. Excellent service.
My husband and I went there for our wedding anniversary. The food was fantastic, the atmosphere was good and the service is superb. I recommend this place
We just stopped in for a glass of wine. They have a nice selection of wines by the glass. The Pinot noir is very good. We also had the cheese plate with the wine. A great combination.

This was one of the BEST meals I've had in a long time. 

We had Duck that melted in your mouth. Vegetables in an amazing sauce. Escargot that was perfectly made. And Creme Brulee to top it off.

All paired with perfect wine choices.

I'm getting hungry thinking about it!

This was our second trip to Denver, and our 3rd time to enjoy the Bistro, which I highly recommend, quality French cuisine, hands down. My associate and myself, both ordered the "steak Classique, which came with pomme frittes that were tossed in a champagne and white truffle oil reduction, most excellent, for dessert, we both indulged in the crème brulee', a dessert guaranteed not to disappoint. Our first time, this trip, our server was Aaron, great server, very attentive, the second night we had dinner, our server was Mikal, truly another quality server. I say "hidden gem", because the entrance is in a corridor that has different shops, but, once you have found the Bistro, you have found a little piece of heaven.

We don't get to Denver as often as we would like but the Bistro Vendome is our favorite restaurant in this area. Aaron was our server and was excellent. He told us about the specials but we both knew what we wanted. Appetizers my friend ordered the escargot and I order the steak tartare both which were excellent. We both had the Steak Frites Classique which comes with the bearnaise sauce and pommes Frites. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the pommes frites are cook with white truffle oil champagne reduction were wonderful. We topped of the meal with Creme Brulee. This is one of the finest restaurants in Denver and I highly recommend visiting this fine French restaurant in downtown Denver!

We were walking past this place during the sidewalk chalk festival and it looked so cute. The manager was very friendly and said to get the chicken - but it takes 30 minutes - and also the chocolate dessert which takes 20. All 4 of us got both of those and really that chicken was fantastic! I wish I lived there just so I could go back!

Such a cozy little place to escape from the hustle and bustle! My husband and I both had the steak frites, which were prepared to perfection, as well as sharing the carrot dish from the appetizers. Wish we could have stayed for dessert, but we had places to go afterwards.

We stopped into Bistro Vendome to see the restaurant.  When we spoke to the Maitre De, he had suggested the chicken and chocolate souffle.  We decided to go and act on his recommendation.  Our party of four all ordered the same thing and all agreed it was one of our top five meals of all time!  The chicken as absolutely delicious and worth the 25 minute wait for it to be prepared.  You will not go wrong ordering this!
reviewTitle: Best Chicken I Have Ever Had!

reviewText: Service was excellent, great wine list, the food was good but not outstanding, best cup of coffee we've had for a long time.
reviewTitle: Classic US take on a French bistro

reviewText: The restaurant is pleasant in appearance, and very nice in many respects. We enjoyed it. Three and a half stars is about right. Very good service. We had the duck confit salad as an entree and Steak Frites. The salad was nice and the beef was excellent and well cooked. A word about the frites (French fries): in all my years visiting and occasionally living in France I never had frites with sugar or some other weird concoction on them. As far as I know the French don't do that. And it was not good, in our opinion.
reviewTitle: Not exactly French in terms of food sensibility

reviewText: Yesterday before the theatre we were wondering around looking for a place for lunch. We happened into a small courtyard and found this cute little French Bistro. We couldn't have planned a better brunch. The food was amazing and the serrvice was great. I know we'll be going back.

Happened on Bistro Vendome by accident.on a recent Sunday afternoon. I am French so have a good idea of what I want from a French Bistro. Great service, very good food & great value. Bistro met all . Plus half price bottles of wine on Saturday/Sunday brunch ! Highly recommended.
I've only been there for happy hour. Fantastic wine menu and service. Will definitely go back again.

In Denver for a show at the Buell, wanted to eat somewhere different and read about this restaurant. We didn’t have a reservation, but sat in the courtyard. The food was excellent and the staff was too. We had the steak with frittes, cheese appetizer, and it was really wonderful. We will definitely come back.

We met a friend for dinner.  The setting is great, in a courtyard well off busy Larimer Street, and with a nice terrace that must be nice when the weather is good.  The weather was very cold when we went, so the warm tones inside set the right mood for the poor weather outside.
I tried the escargots, and my wife and I split orders of sauteed scallops and steak frites.
The food was excellent overall, although the escargots were not served piping hot, as I like them.  The scallops were tender and perfectly cooked, and the steak likewise so. The service was excellent.
The wine list is good, and we chose a Corbieres, not seen too often on US wine lists – it was good, and though pricey compared to getting the same in France, it’s fair to say that it very hard to get a good deal on a decent wine in a US restaurant.
The atmosphere was one of low conversations and subdued light, but not dim.  Pleasant and a good setting for a conversation at the table, not too loud to hear everyone.  The décor is well- done and fitting the bistro theme.
All in all, two thumbs up!
reviewTitle: Relaxing and good food, great place to eat and chat with friends

reviewText: The Vendome is a great restaurant. Service is super and the food excellent. I had the Onion Soup which although a small serving was very good. I then had the steak tartare which although very good was a little salty for my taste and could have been more spicy. Something to remember to ask when I go back. Enjoyed the meal very much.

We had dinner here on some Patrick’s day evening. The place was full so we sat at the bar. 
the service from the excellent bartender and the meal was excellent. We also enjoyed  a half-price bottle wine deal which even made it more appealing.

Had been looking forward to trying what looked like a charming restaurant in Angel Square on Larimer st.    However, we were most disappointed in the food...both entrees were overly salted--ruined the flavors of the duck and the scallops, outweighing everything else.  The portion of the scallops entree was minimal and they were small scallops.  The duck portion (leg /thigh) was fine but again salty. The escargot appetizer was also disappointing.  The dessert offered as 'chocolate souffle' was not at all a souffle; it was more like one of those hot lava chocolate cakes in a cup----nothing at all of the texture or definition of a smooth, light & airy souffle.  Because of the quality of the food, I felt that everything was overpriced, even during restaurant week!
Our waiter was attentive, friendly, perfectly timed, and cognizant of our time since we were attending the theater afterwards although we were not in any rush. 
We were here on a Saturday night and although busy early, the place was emptied out by the time we left for an 8pm show.   
Do not plan to return or recommend

Our party of 8 sat for over an hour before getting served. When we queried what the issue was the employee stated they were serving a "large party" and were very busy. The food was only fair with one dish being seriously undercooked. 
No managerial staff seemed to be concerned with the issue.
This evening out was a spectacular disappointment.

The food was phenomenal! We had a Steak Tartare, Crispy duck leg confit, Braised beef and Steak frites and all the mains were delicious. Having visited France several times we found their food to be very authentic. 

Great ambience, quick service and delicious food. Highly recommended!

We loved the restaurant, and Larimer street was beautifully lit.  We used the valet parking  which made parking stress free, during the holiday season.
